materials: Bernat® Bundle Up™ (4.9 oz/140 g; 267 yds/244 m)
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stuffing. Two pieces of 20” [51 cm] long dowel. White glue. Sewing needle and nylon thread.
measurements: Approx 20" [51 cm] assembled from point to point.
gauge: 15 hdc and 12 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes:
• Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as hdc.
• Join all rnds with sl st to first st.

SUN (make 2)
With C, ch 3.
1st rnd: 10 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join. 10 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join. 20 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 50 hdc.
6th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 60 hdc.
7th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 70 hdc.
8th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 80 hdc.
Fasten off.

MERCURY (make 2)
With B, ch 3.
1st rnd: 10 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join. 10 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join. 20 hdc. Fasten off.
With both sides of Mercury held WS tog, join B with sl st.
Joining rnd: With B, work as for Sun.

VENUS (make 2)
With C, ch 3.
1st rnd: 10 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join with A. 10 hdc.
2nd rnd: With A, ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join with C. 20 hdc.
3rd rnd: With C, ch 2. *1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Break C. Join with A. 30 hdc.
4th rnd: With A, ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 hdc. Fasten off.
With both sides of Venus held WS tog, join A with sl st.
Joining rnd: With A, work as for Sun.

EARTH (make 2)
With E, ch 3.
1st rnd: 10 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join. 10 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join. 20 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 hdc.
Fasten off.
With D, surface sl st ‘continents’ onto Earth as shown in photo.
With both sides of Earth held WS tog, join E with sl st.
Joining rnd: With E, work as for Sun.

MARS (make 2)
With A, ch 3.
1st rnd: 10 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join. 10 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join. 20 hdc. Fasten off.
With both sides of Mars held WS tog, join A with sl st.
Joining rnd: With A, work as for Sun.

JUPITER (make 2)
With B, ch 3.
1st rnd: 10 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join. 10 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join. 20 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 50 hdc.
6th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 60 hdc.
7th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 70 hdc. Fasten off.
With A, surface sl st red dot onto Jupiter as shown in photo. With C, surface sl st stripes onto Jupiter as shown in photo.
With both sides of Jupiter held WS tog, join B with sl st.
Joining rnd: With B, work as for Sun.

SATURN (make 2)
With C, ch 3.
1st rnd: 10 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join. 10 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join. 20 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 50 hdc.
6th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 60 hdc. Fasten off.

With both sides of Saturn held WS tog, join C with sl st.
Joining rnd: With C, work as for Sun.

Saturn Rings (make 2):
With B, ch 24.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to last ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working into opposite side of foundation ch, 1 sc in each ch to last ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join.
Fasten off.
Attach Rings to Saturn as shown in photo.

URANUS (make 2)
With D, ch 3.
1st rnd: 10 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join. 10 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join. 20 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 50 hdc. Fasten off.
With both sides of Uranus held WS tog, join D with sl st.
Joining rnd: With D, work as for Sun.

NEPTUNE (make 2)
With E, ch 3.
1st rnd: 10 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join. 10 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join. 20 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 50 hdc. Fasten off.
With both sides of Neptune held WS tog, join E with sl st.
Joining rnd: With E, work as for Sun.

ASSEMBLY
Create an “X” with dowels. Glue tog in center and reinforce with length of B. Tie 30” [76 cm] lengths of B to each end of dowels. Gather tog and tie in knot to hang.
Cut 9 pieces of thread in various lengths and tie two strands to each arm of dowel X and one in center for Sun. Attach all Planets to lengths of thread, making sure Mobile is balanced in weight.

materials: RED HEART® “Soft Yarn®”: 1 skein each 2515 Turquoise A, 4422 Tangerine B, and 9779 Berry C
10 yd spool of ¼” white satin ribbon
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions given in brackets the number of times specified
gauge: 17 sc = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
MOBILE
Heart Half (make 6 small heart halves each in A, B and C; make 4 large heart halves each in A, B and C)
Ch 11 (17).
Round 1: 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each of next 3 (6) ch, skip next 2 ch, sc in each of next 3 (6) ch, 3 sc in last ch, working across opposite side of foundation ch, sc in each of next 3 (6) ch, (sc, ch 2, sc) in next ch-2 space, sc in each of next 3 (6) ch. Do not join rounds, Work in a spiral, marking first st of each round, moving marker up as work progresses.
Round 2: 2 sc in each of next 3 sc, sc in each of next 2 (5) sc, skip next 2 sc, sc in each of next 2 (5) sc, 2 sc in each of next 3 sc, sc in each of next 4 (7) sc, (sc, ch 2, sc) in next ch-2 space, sc in each of next 4 (7) sc.
Round 3: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc] 3 times, sc in each of next 1 (4) sc, skip next 2 sc, sc in each of next 1 (4) sc, [2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc] 3 times, sc in each of next 4 (7) sc, (sc, ch 2, sc) in next ch-2 space, sc in each of next 5 (8) sc. For small heart, join with slip st in next sc and fasten off
Large Heart Only
Round 4: Sc in next sc, [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc] 3 times, sc in each of next 2 sc, skip next 2 sc, sc in each of next 4 sc, [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc] 3 times, sc in each of next 8 sc, (sc, ch 2, sc) in next ch-2 space, sc in each of next 9 sc.
Round 5: Sc in next 2 sc, [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc] 3 times, skip next 2 sc, sc in each of next 3 sc, [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc] 3 times, sc in each of next 9 sc, (sc, ch 2, sc) in next ch-2 space, sc in each of next 10 sc; join with slip st in next sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends. With wrong sides facing, line up 2 matching heart halves. Using matching yarn, slip st around edge through both hearts, stuff lightly when 2” from the end. Repeat for all hearts.
Layout hearts in groupings – 6 groupings with either 2 or 3 hearts, arrange colors as desired. Cut a 24” length of ribbon. Tie an overhand knot in ribbon 1” from end, tie a second knot on top of first knot. Put ribbon onto yarn needle, insert needle into a heart from bottom to top, slide heart to knot. Decide position for next heart, tie another knot for base of heart, thread heart onto ribbon. Tie an overhand knot 1” from end of each ribbon. Repeat for each grouping. 
Cut two 1 yard lengths of ribbon. Fold in half and knot together, about 2” from fold for a hanging loop.
Open embroidery hoop. Arrange strings of hearts, evenly spaced around hoop. Close embroidery hoop over ends of ribbons. Tie ends of hanging ribbons, evenly spaced around hoop. Wrap remaining ribbon around embroidery hoop in a candy cane stripe as pictured. Tie ends to secure. Trim ends.

materials: RED HEART® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 1 ball each 480 Delft A and 201 White B
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Banner measures ¾” (2 cm) wide x 48” (122 cm) long. Star of David Motif measures 3¼” (8.5 cm) wide x 5” (12.5 cm) long after blocking.
gauge: With 3.75mm [F-5] hook and holding two strands together, 5 sc = 1” (2.5 cm), 6 rows sc = 1” (2.5 cm). Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
Star of David Motif (Make 6 with A and 5 with B)
Triangle 1
With 2 strands held together and leaving 6” (15 cm) tail, ch 42.
Round 1: Sc in 2nd from hook and in next 3 ch, (sc, ch 2, sc) in next ch, sc in next 14 ch, (sc, ch 2, sc) in next ch, sc in next 10 ch, (sc, ch 2, sc) in next ch, sc in last 10 ch; join with slip st in first sc—44 sc (2 sides of 16 sc each and 1 side of 12 sc) and 3 ch-2 spaces.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in same st as join and next 4 sc, (sc, ch 2, sc) in next ch-2 space, sc in next 16 sc, (sc, ch 2, sc) in next ch-2 space, sc in next 12 sc, (sc, ch 2, sc) in next ch-2 space, sc in last 11 sc; join with slip st in first sc—50 sc (2 sides of 18 sc each and 1 side of 14 sc) and 3 ch-2 spaces. Fasten off.
Triangle 2
Round 1: Same as triangle 1 Round 1.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in same st as join and next 4 sc, (sc, ch 4, sc) in next ch-2 space (hanging loop made), sc in next 16 sc, (sc, ch 2, sc) in next ch-2 space, sc in next 12 sc, (sc, ch 2, sc) in next ch-2 space, sc in last 11 sc; join with slip st in first sc—50 sc (2 sides of 18 sc each and 1 side of 14 sc) and 3 ch-spaces. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Motifs
With beginning tail, join first and last stitches of Round 1 of each triangle at lower edge; weave in ends. Block and stiffen each triangle to 3¼” (8.5 cm) wide across lower edge x 4” (10 cm) long. Using photograph as a guide, with right sides facing, and with hanging loop of triangle 2 at top, place triangle 1 upside down on top of triangle 2 and sew or glue together where outer edges meet.
Banner
Row 1: With two strands of A held together, work as many Fhdc as needed for 48” (122 cm) length, alternating colors when joining each motif with Fhdc-join at intervals of 4” (10 cm); change to B in last st, turn.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each st; change to A, turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, hdc in first st, ch 12, hdc in same st and in each st across, ch 12, hdc in last st. Fasten off and weave in ends. Stiffen banner, if desired.

pattern_name: Butterflies and Flowers for Baby’s Crib Mobile
materials: Lily® Sugar ’n Cream (Solids: 70.9 g/2.5 oz/109 m/120 yds): 1 ball each of: Yellow (MC); White (A); Blue (B); Aqua (C)
Lily® Sugar ’n Cream (Ombres: 56.7 g/2 oz/86 m/95 yds): 1 ball Ombres (D)
Sizes 3.5 mm (U.S. E or 4) and 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge
1 yd [.95 cm] of ribbon ¼ inch [.5 cm] wide
measurements: The completed butterflies should approximate 4-5 inches in size depending on the hook size and tension.
gauge: 16 sc and 20 rows = 4 ins [10 cm] with smaller hook
instructions:
BUTTERFLY
Wings
(make 1 each with MC, B and C). Front and Back (make alike).
With MC, ch 7. 
1st row:(RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn.
6 sc. 
2nd row:Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
**3rd to 5th rows: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 12 sc. 
6th row:Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
7th row:Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook - Sc2tog made. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 
8th row:Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn. 
9th row:Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. Turn. 
10th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Fasten off. 
With RS of work facing, join MC with sl st to rem sts and proceed as follows:
Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to last 2 sts. Sc2tog over last 2 sts. Turn.
3rd row:Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. Turn. 
4th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Fasten off.** 
With RS of work facing, join MC with sl st to opposite side of foundation chain. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 6 sc. 
Work from ** to ** as given above. 
Note: When joining Back and Front, place small amount of stuffing in each Wing.
Joining Back and Front: 1st rnd:
With WS of Back and Front facing tog, join MC with sl st to side of foundation chain. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st.
*7 sc up right side of first Wing. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) all in top st of Wing. 4 sc down left side of first Wing. 4 sc up right side of second Wing. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) all in top st of Wing. 7 sc down left side of second Wing. 1 sc between Wings. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd:*Sl st in each of next 8 sc up right side of first Wing. Ch 3. Sl st in first ch of ch 3 - Picot made. Sl st in each of next 5 sc down left side of first Wing. Sl st in each of next 5 sc up right side of second Wing. Picot. Sl st in each of next 8 sc down left side of second Wing. Sl st between Wings. Rep from * around. Fasten off. 
Body: With D, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 4 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join in rnd with sl st in first sc. 
2nd rnd:Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st in first sc. 6 sc. 
3rd rnd:Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Join with sl st in first sc. 8 sc. 
4th to 9th rnds:Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st in first sc. 
Stuff Body. 
Head: Next rnd:Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 4 times. Join with sl st in first sc. 
Next 2 rnds:Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st in first sc. 
Stuff Head. 
Next rnd:Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 8 times. Join with sl st in first sc.
Next rnd:Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 4 times. Join with sl st in first sc.
Next rnd:Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. Fasten off.
Sew Body to Wings as shown in picture.
Flower Appliques
(make 2 for each Butterfly).
With D, ch 4. Join in rnd. 
1st rnd:Ch 1. 10 sc in rnd. Join with sl st in first sc. Fasten off. 
2nd rnd:Join A with sl st to any sc. Miss first sc. (3 dc in next sc. Sl st in next sc) 5 times. Fasten off. 
Sew one Flower Applique to each Wing as illustrated. 
FLOWER
(make 1 each with MC, A and B).
Front and Back (make alike).
With C, ch 2. 
1st rnd:5 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd:Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st. 2 sc in each of next 4 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 10 sc. Break C. 
First Petal:Join MC with sl st to any sc. 
**1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 2 sc in next sc. 3 sc. Turn. 
2nd row:Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in last sc. 5 sc. Turn. 
3rd to 5th rows:Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
6th row:Ch 1. Draw up a loop in each of first 2 sc. Yoh and draw up a loop through all loops on hook – Sc2tog made. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog over last 2 sc. 3 sts. Turn. 
7th row:Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 sc in last st. 2 sts. Turn. 
8th row:Ch 1. Sc2tog over 2 sts. Fasten off.**
Second to Fifth Petals: Join MC with sl st to next sc of 2nd rnd. Work from ** to ** as given for First Petal. 
Note: When joining Back and Front, place small amount of stuffing in each Petal. 
Joining Back and Front:Place Back and Front with WS facing tog. Join MC with sl st between 2 Petals.
Working through both thicknesses, proceed as follows:
1st rnd:*5 sc up right side of Petal. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) all in top of Petal. 5 sc down left side of Petal. Sl st between Petals. Rep from * around. Fasten off. 
2nd rnd: Join C, with sl st to any sl st between Petals. *Sl st in each of next 7 sc up right side of Petal. Ch 3. Sl st in first ch of ch 3 - Picot made. Sl st in each of next 6 sc down left side of Petal. Sl st between Petals. Rep from * around. Fasten off. 
CRIB RIBBON
With D and larger hook, ch 128. 
1st row:(RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *Miss next 2 ch. 5 dc in next ch. Miss next 2 ch. 1 sc in next ch.* Rep from * to end of ch. Do not turn.
Working in opposite side of ch, proceed as follows: 2 sc in same sp as last sc. Rep from * to * once more. 2 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. 
Short Ties (make 3).
With A, ch 15. Fasten off. 
Med Ties (make 3).
With A, ch 20. Fasten off.
Long Ties (make 2).
With A, ch 30. Fasten off. 
Sew Butterflies and Flowers to Crib Ribbon alternating Short and Med Ties as illustrated. Fold 2 long Ties and sew to each end to attach Crib Ribbon to crib. 
Thread ribbon through shells as shown in picture.

materials: RED HEART® Mixology Solids™: 1 ball each 342 Taupe A and 102 Ivory C
RED HEART® Mixology Print™: 1 ball 959 Retro Print B
RED HEART Mixology Swirl™: 1 ball 9959 Retro D
RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein 313 Aran E
Large eye yarn needle, ¼” diameter x 12” long (6 mm x 30.5 cm) dowel or stick and 1 yd (.91 meters) twine
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
measurements: Wall hanging measures 6½” wide and 11” long (16.5 x 28 cm)
gauge: 6 sts = 4” (10 cm); 4 rows = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE.
instructions:
WALL HANGING
With A, ch 11.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; change to B, turn—10 sts. Cut A.
Row 2: Ch 4 (counts as first tr here and throughout), tr in each st across; change to C, turn. Cut B.
Row 3: Ch 2 (counts as first hdc here and throughout), hdc in each st across, turn.
Row 4: Ch 4, tr in each st across; change to A, turn. Cut C.
Row 5: Ch 2, hdc in each st across; change to D, drop A, turn.
Row 6: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in each st across; change to A, turn. Cut D.
Row 7: Ch 3, dc in next 2 sts; change to B, drop A, dc in next 4 sts; change to C, drop B, d in last 3 sts, turn.
Row 8: Ch 3, dc in next 2 sts; change to B, drop C, dc in next 4 sts; change to A, drop B, dc in last 3 sts, turn.
Row 9: Repeat Row 7; change to D at end of row. Cut A, B, and C.
Rows 10–11: Repeat Row 3.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Refer to photograph as a guide for placement.
Fringe
Cut 24 strands of E, each 8” (20.5 cm) long; separate into 6 groups of 4 strands. Fold strands in half to form a loop. With right side facing and working in opposite side of foundation chains, insert crochet hook from front to back in first stitch. Place fold on hook and draw fold through, forming a loop. Thread ends of strands through loop and pull to tighten. Repeat to attach fringe to next 2 stitches and last 3 stitches. Trim ends evenly.
Hanging Loops
Cut 5 strands of E, each 8” (20.5 cm) long. Fold each strand in half and tie ends together with an overhand knot to form a loop. With right side and top edge facing, thread folded end of loop from front to back through ch-3 space of Row 11, open strands of hanging loop below knot and insert the folded end. Pull up the folded end so knotted end tightens around stitch. Repeat to join remaining 4 hanging loops in top of 4th, 6th, 8th, and last stitches. Adjust as needed to place knots on wrong side. Weave in ends.
Insert dowel or stick through hanging loops and tie on twine for hanging.

materials: Caron® One Pound™ (16 oz/453.6 g; 812 yds/742 m) Fig (10643) 2 balls
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
1" [2.5 cm] diameter x 36" [91.5 cm] long dowel.
5" [12.5 cm], 9" [23 cm], 18" [45.5 cm] and 30" [76 cm] wide pieces of cardboard for tassels.
abbreviations: Splhdc = Split half double crochet: work hdc between ‘legs’ at front and back of stitch (splitting stitch) instead of through top loops.
Splhdc2tog = [Yoh and draw up a loop in between “legs” at front and back of stitch (splitting stitch) instead of through top loops] in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Splhdc3tog = [Yoh and draw up a loop in between “legs” at front and back of stitch (splitting stitch) instead of through top loops] in each of next 3 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 32" [81.5 cm] wide x 36" [91.5 cm] tall, including fringe and after hanging.
gauge: 17 sts and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Notes:
• Worked over foundation ch multiple of 8 ch +10.
• Piece is worked from Top down. 
• Pat creates a curved bottom edge as side edges of pat work-up shorter than central pat repeats.
• Piece will stretch to size once hung on dowel.
CROCHET  I  SKILL LEVEL: INTERMEDIATE
Ch 146. See diagram on page 3.
1st row: (WS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook (counts as 2 hdc). Ch 7. Skip next 5 ch. *1 hdc in each of next 3 ch. Ch 7. Skip next 5 ch. Rep from * to last 2 ch. 1 hdc in each of last 2 ch. Turn. 181 sts (including hdc and ch sts).
2nd row: Ch 2 (counts as 1 hdc). 1 splhdc in next hdc. Ch 3. *Skip next 3 ch. 3 hdc in next ch. Ch 3. Skip next 3 ch. Splhdc3tog. Ch 3. Rep from * to last ch-7. Skip next 3 ch. 3 hdc in next ch. Ch 3. Skip next 3 ch. Splhdc2tog (working in last hdc and ch-2). Turn.
3rd row:  Ch 5 (counts as 1 hdc. Ch 3). Skip next 3 ch. 1 splhdc in each of next 3 hdc. *Ch 7. Skip next: (Ch-3. Splhdc3tog. Ch-3). 1 splhdc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * to last ch-3. Ch 3. Skip next 3 ch. 1 hdc in top of last hdc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 2 (counts as 1 hdc) 1 hdc in first hdc. Ch 3. Skip next 3 ch. *Splhdc3tog. Ch 3. Skip next 3 ch. 3 hdc in next ch. Ch 3. Skip next 3 ch. Rep from * to last 3 hdc before last ch-3. Splhdc3tog. Ch 3. Skip next 3 ch. 2 hdc in next ch. Turn.
5th row: Ch 2 (counts as 1 hdc). 1 splhdc in next hdc. Ch 7. Skip next: (Ch-3. Splhdc3tog. Ch-3). *1 Splhdc in each of next 3 hdc. Ch 7. Skip next: (Ch-3. Splhdc3tog. Ch-3). Rep from * to last 2 hdc. 1 splhdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn.
6th to 45th rows: Rep 2nd to 5th rows 10 times more, ending on a 5th row. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Fringe:  Cut strands of yarn 12" [30.5 cm] long. (Taking 1 strand, fold in half and knot into fringe) 7 times in each ch-7 sp and once into each hdc along Bottom edge of Wall Hanging (45th row). Trim fringe evenly.
Weave wooden dowel through top edge (as shown in photo).
DECORATIONS
Pompoms (make 4): Wind yarn around 4 fingers approx 150 times. Tie yarn tightly in the middle and leave long ends for attaching to Wall Hanging. Cut loops at both ends and trim to smooth round shape (if desired, make different sizes by winding around more or fewer fingers).
Tassels (make one of each 5" [12.5 cm], 9" [23 cm], 18" [45.5 cm], and 30" [76 cm] long): Wrap yarn around piece of cardboard 50 times. Tie securely at one end leaving Long Tails. Cut across other end. Wrap yarn 3 times around tassel 1" [2.5 cm] from tied end and fasten securely.
Sew Pompoms and Tassels to top left-hand corner of Wall Hanging layering tassels below pompoms as shown in diagram. Braid small sections of the longer tassels, tying at the ends to secure, for added texture (as shown in photo on page 3).

pattern_name: Sun Moon & Mountains Crochet Wall Hanging
materials: Red Heart® Super Saver™ (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Contrast A Jade (3862) 1 ball or 45 yds/41.5 m
Contrast B Minty (0520) 1 ball or 36 yds/33 m
Contrast C Aran (0313) 1 ball or 98 yds/89.5 m
Contrast D Oatmeal (0326) 1 ball or 36 yds/33 m
Contrast E Pretty‘n Pink (0722) 1 ball or 45 yds/41.5 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 18" x 23" [45.5 x 58.5 cm] excluding fringe.
gauge: 12 sc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes: 
• When working from chart use intarsia technique. Wind small balls of the colors to be used, one for each separate area of color in the design. 
• When changing yarn colors, work to last 2 loops on hook of last st. Draw new color through 2 loops, then proceed in new color. 
WALL HANGING
With B, ch 9. Join A and work a further ch 46. 55 ch in total. Work Chart (see page 2), noting each square of chart is equal to 1 sc and reading RS rows from right to left and WS rows from left to right. Do not carry color not in use across top of previous row. 
1st row: Following Chart, 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 54 sc. 
2nd row: Ch 1 and cont following Chart, working 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Rep 2nd row until all 72 rows of chart are complete. Do not fasten off. 
Next row: With C, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last row 5 times more. 
Fasten off leaving long tail for sewing. 
Fold Wall Hanging 6 rows from top edge and sew to WS for dowel casing. 
Fringe 
Cut lengths of each shade 16" [40.5 cm] long. Taking 3 strands tog, fold in half and knot into fringe along bottom of Wall Hanging. Trim fringe evenly. Insert dowel into casing and tie yarn at each end for hanging loop as shown.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 312 Black A, 316 Soft White B, 254 Pumpkin C, and 672 Spring Green D.
Yarn needle, polyester fiberfill, stitch marker, sewing thread and needle, ten 5mm black buttons for eyes, two 9mm safety eyes (or buttons).
abbreviations: A, B, C, D = color A, B, C, D
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Bat measures 4½” [11 cm] high x 8½” [22 cm] wide. Pumpkin measures 4” [10 cm] high x 4½” [11 cm] wide. Skull measures 5” [13 cm] high x 4½” [11 cm] wide.
gauge: 16 sts = 4” [10 cm]; 8 rows = 4” [10 cm]. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
FINISHING
With B, use the remaining yarn tail to sew eyes to Bat and embroider mouth and teeth as pictured with Straight sts. Sew buttons to eyes as pictured. Weave in ends.
PUMPKIN (Make 2)
Rounds 1-3: With C, work same as Bat Rounds 1-3. – 32 dc.
Round 4: Sc in next 2 dc, 2 hdc in next dc, 2 dc in next 8 dc, hdc in next 3 dc, sc in next 4 dc, hdc in next 3 dc, 2 dc in next 8 dc, 2 hdc in next dc, sc in next 2 dc changing to D in last sc.
Leaf
With D, ch 7; slip st in 2nd ch from hook, hdc in next ch, dc in next 2 ch, hdc in next ch, slip st in last ch, slip st in next st on Pumpkin, ch 4, sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next ch, (sc, slip st) in last ch. Fasten off.
Eyes
First Eye
With B, ch 2; 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with a slip st to first sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Second eye
Round 1: With B, ch 2; 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook; do not join.
Round 2: 2 Sc in each sc around; join with a slip st to first sc – 10 sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew eyes to Pumpkin using remaining yarn tail of B, sew buttons on to eyes, and with A embroider teeth as pictured. Weave in ends.
BAT (Make 3)
Body
Round 1: With A, ch 4; 8 dc in 4th ch from hook; do NOT join but work in continuous rounds. Place marker in first st and move up each round.
Round 2: 2 Dc in each dc around – 16 dc.
Round 3: 2 Dc in each dc around – 32 dc.
Ears-Round 4: Sc in next dc, * ch 4, slip st in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next 2 ch **, 2 dc in next dc on Body, hdc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from * to ** once more, sc in next dc, slip st in next dc. Do not fasten off but continue with Wing.
Wing
Row 1: Ch 3, dc in same dc as slip st, dc in next 5 dc; turn – 6 dc.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc), dc in next 6 dc; turn – 7 sts.
Rows 3 and 4: Repeat Row 2.
Row 5: Ch 3, hdc in next dc, dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc, slip st in next dc – 5 sts. Fasten off.
With wrong side facing, join A in 2nd st from Ear and repeat Rows 1-5 for next Wing.
Eye (Make 2)
With B, ch 2; 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with a slip st to first sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing and embroidery.
SKULL (Make 2)
Body
Rounds 1-3: With D, work same as Bat Rounds 1-3 – 32 dc.
Round 4: [2 Dc in next dc, dc in next dc] 16 times – 48 dc. Do not fasten off but continue with Mouth.
Mouth
Row 1: Ch 3, dc in same dc, dc in next 7 dc; turn – 8 dc.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc), dc in next 8 dc; turn – 9 sts.
Row 3: Ch 2 (counts as hdc), hdc in next 7 dc, ch 2, slip st in top of ch-3. Fasten off.
Eyeball
Round 1: With B, ch 2; 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook; do not join but work in continuous rounds.
Round 2: 2 Sc in each sc around – 10 sc.
Round 3: 2 Sc in each sc around – 20 sc.
Rounds 4-6: Sc in each sc around.
Round 7: [Dec] 10 times – 10 sc.
If using 9mm safety eye, place now in the center of Round 1. Add stuffing.
Round 8: [Dec] 5 times – 5 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. With yarn needle, weave tail through remaining sts and pull tight.
FINISHING
With remaining tail from Eyeball, attach to Skull so Eyeball will hang about an inch away as pictured. With A, embroider a mouth, nose and other eye for Skull as pictured. Weave in ends.
FINISHING FOR BANNER
With yarn needle weave a long tail of A through the wings of the Bat, the tip of the Leaf of the Pumpkin and through the Skull’s head as pictured. Add the rest as pictured. Make as many more Bats, Pumpkins and Skulls as you want and add them in the order you like.

materials: 2 balls of 9530 Berry Glamorous, 1 ball of 9562 Purple Panache.
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 3.75 mm [US F-5] and 6 mm [US J-10]
16-gauge wire, approx. 75” (190.5 cm) for each butterfly, needle-nose pliers, paper for diagram outline of 17” wide x 13” high (43 x 33 cm), wire cutters, yarn needle
abbreviations: () = work directions in parentheses into same st
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Butterfly measures: 17” wide x 13” high (43 x 33 cm)
gauge: With smaller hook, Small Motif = 3½” (9 cm) in diameter; With larger hook Large Motif = GAUGE. Use any size to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
First make a butterfly-shaped frame with wire, then use this glam yarn with oval sequins to crochet floral motifs and attach them to butterfly-shaped wire frames. It’s a wonderful way to decorate a wall and add a touch of whimsical fun to your décor!

Beginning 4-treble crochet cluster (beg 4-tr cluster): Ch 3, *yarn over (twice), insert hook in space, yarn over, draw up a loop, [yarn over, draw yarn through 2 loops on hook] twice, repeat from * twice in same space, yarn over, draw yarn through 4 loops on hook.

4 Treble crochet cluster (4-tr cluster): *Yarn over (twice), insert hook in space, yarn over, draw up a loop, [yarn over, draw yarn through 2 loops on hook] twice, repeat from * 3 times in same space, yarn over, draw yarn through 5 loops on hook.

Assemble Frame:
Draw a diagram of butterfly wings on paper so butterfly measures 17” x 13” [43 x 33 cm]. This would be about 420% enlargement. Lay large size diagram on work surface.
Using pliers, bend about 1” (2.5 cm) over at end of wire to form loop. Place wire on diagram, lining loop up with * at center bottom of diagram. Carefully bend wire to match outer path of frame on diagram until wire meets up with beginning loop. Cut wire 1” (2.5 cm) beyond meeting point. Thread this end of wire through starting loop and bend over about 1” (2.5 cm) to lock in place. Cut an 8½” (21.5 cm) length of wire, bending both ends over about 1” (2.5 cm). Slide loops over wire frame at center points * and **. Tighten loops to secure. Note: You may need to shorten center piece to make your frame more-sturdy and hold the butterfly shape.

Flower Motif (make 2 with smaller hook and 2 with larger hook for each butterfly): Ch 5 and join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Beg 4-tr cluster in ring, ch 5, [4-tr cluster, ch 5] 4 times in ring; join with slip st to top of beg 4-tr cluster – 5 petals.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in first cluster, *ch 7, (sc, ch 5, sc) in next ch-5 space, ch 7**, sc in next cluster; repeat from * around ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in first sc – 10 ch-7 spaces; 5 ch-5 spaces. Fasten off.

Covering Frame
Round 1: With larger hook, join yarn with slip st around frame at * (center bottom), ch 1, working around right-hand side of frame, following arrows, sc closely and evenly around to **, then, sc evenly around left side of butterfly to *, then, sc evenly up center bar of frame to **.
Round 2: Starting at **, ch 1, sc in each st around frame, working as follows between points A and B on each top wing: [dc in each of next 2 sts, 2 dc in next st] across; working slip st in each st between points C and D; and working hdc in each st between points E and F; at end of rnd, join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.

Joining First Flower Motif: Using yarn needle and long length of matching yarn, attach motif to center of appropriate wing section as follows: Tie a knot to frame; *insert needle through next ch-5 or ch-7 space of Motif, insert needle through corresponding position on Round 1 on frame; repeat from * around. Do not fasten off.

Joining of Second and Successive Motifs: Repeat Joining First Motif to join remaining 3 Motifs to Frame, following Assembly diagram for placement. Fasten off and secure yarn after joining all 4 Motifs. Note: Pattern of joining threads can vary from butterfly to butterfly but try to keep each butterfly symmetrical.

FINISHING: Weave in ends. Note: Cut out sequins that remain on yarn tails to make it easier to weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 265 Redwood A, 528 Medium Purple B, 625 Guava C, 321 Gold D, and 726 Coral E
Note Only small quantities of each color are needed for this project.
Cousin® Corporation of America: Natural Polished Hemp cord, Wood Bead Mix (60 wood beads)
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Banner measures 56" (142 cm). Leaf measures 4" (10 cm) wide x 5½" (14 cm) long, including stem.
gauge: Rounds 1 and 2 = 2" (5 cm). Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
BANNER
Leaf (make 3 with A and 2 each with B, C, D & E)
Make an adjustable ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, 11 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc—11 sc.
Round 2: Ch 2 (counts as first dc), dc in same st as join, 2 dc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—22 dc.
Round 3: Skip same st as join, petal in next st, *skip next st, slip st in next st, skip next st, petal in next st; repeat from * 3 times, skip next st, slip st in next 2 sts, ch 13, slip st in 4th ch from hook and in each remaining ch (stem made), slip st in last st—5 petals and 1 ch-3 space.
Fasten off.
ASSEMBLY
Step 1: Cut a strand of hemp measuring 57" (145 cm) long. Tie a double knot 9" (23 cm) from one end.
Step 2: String 5 wooden beads on strand.
Step 3: Inserting strand through ch-3 space, string A-colored leaf.
Repeat Steps 2 and 3 five times, stringing leaves in color sequence as follows: [C, B, E, D, A] twice.
Repeat Step 2 once. Tie a double knot 9" (23 cm) from remaining end.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: 2 balls RED HEART® Sweet Home (9827 Blacklight)
measurements: Wall Hanging measures 20" [51 cm] x 25" [63 cm]
gauge: 9 sc = 4" [10 cm]; 9 rows = 4" [10 cm] in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
BACK PANEL
Ch 41.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each ch to end – 40 sc.
Rows 2-48: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Do not fasten off.

First Hanging Strap
Row 1: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 5 sts, leave remaining sts unworked – 5 sc.
Rows 2-8: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 5 sc.
Row 9: Ch 1, turn, sc in first st, ch 3, skip next 3 sts for buttonhole, sc in last st.
Row 10: Ch 1, turn, sc in first st, 3 sc in ch-3 space, sc in last st. Fasten off.

2nd-6th Strap
Skip 2 next sts from previous Strap along top edge of Back Panel.
Row 1: Join yarn in next st with a slip st, ch 1, sc in same st, sc in next 4 sts – 5 sc.
Repeat Rows 2-10 as for First Hanging Strap.

POCKETS (Make 4)
Ch 18.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each ch to end – 17 sc.
Rows 2-17: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail.

FINISHING
Arrange Pockets on front of Back Panel and sew in place, leaving top edge unsewn.
Sew one button for each Strap along top edge of Back Panel, corresponding button placement with buttonhole. Fold Straps to right side of Back Panel and button in place. Slip dowel through Hanging Straps.
Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Roving™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
2 wooden dowels, ½" [1 cm] diameter x 36" [91.5 cm] long.
4 wooden dowel caps with ½" [1 cm] diameter opening.
abbreviations: Scbl = Single crochet in back loop only
measurements: Approx 32 x 50" [81 x 127 cm].
gauge: 9 sc and 11 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes: 
• Tapestry is worked in intarsia technique. Use separate balls of yarn for each color section in design. Do not carry color not in use across top or back of stitches. 
• To join new color, work to last loops on hook of previous color. Yoh with new color, draw through rem loops and proceed with new color
Bottom Dowel Casing: 
With A, ch 73. 
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 72 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 2" [5 cm], ending on a WS row. 
Proceed as follows:
1st row (fold line): (RS). With A, ch 1. 1 scbl in first sc. 1 scbl in each of next 34 sc. With B, 1 scbl in next sc. With A, 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
2nd row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 34 sc. With C, 1 sc in next sc. With A, 1 sc in next sc. With B, 1 sc in next sc. With C, 1 sc in next sc. With A, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
First 2 rows of Chart are complete. 
Cont as established, working Chart in sc to end of Chart. See pages 3 and 4 for Chart.
Do not fasten off. Break B, C, D and E.
Top Dowel Casing: 
1st row (fold line): (RS). With A, ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
2nd row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Top Dowel Casing measures 2" [5 cm], ending on a WS row. 
Fasten off.
Finishing
Fold Top and Bottom Dowel Casings to WS of Tapestry at fold lines. Sew in position at WS of work to form casing, ensuring sts do not show at RS of work.  
Border:
With RS facing, join A with sl st to first rem front loop of fold line at top right corner of Tapestry. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. Working in rem front loops, 3 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 3 sc in last sc. Work sc evenly down left side of Tapestry to next corner. Working in rem front loops of fold line , 3 sc in first sc.  
1 sc in each sc to last sc. 3 sc in last sc. Work sc evenly up right side of Tapestry to first sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. 
Optional: Spray paint dowels. 
Insert dowels into Top and Bottom Dowel Casings. Glue Dowel Caps to each end of Dowels. 
Outlines: Using chain st embroidery and A, outline each color section as seen in picture.

pattern_name: PEAK YOUR INTEREST C2C CROCHET TAPESTRY
materials: Red Heart® Hygge™ (5 oz/141 g; 132 yds/121 m)
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
½ ' [12.5 mm] diameter wooden dowel approx 31" [78.5 cm] long.
gauge: 12 dc and 6 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note:
• Tapestry is worked diagonally 
from corner to corner.
• When working from chart, wind 
small balls of the colors to be 
used, one for each separate area 
of color in the design. Start new 
colors at appropriate points.
• To change color, work to last 
loops on hook of previous 
color. Yoh with new color, draw 
through rem loops and proceed 
with new color.
With A, ch 6. 
(See Chart on page 2)
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from 
hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each 
of last 2 ch. Turn. 1 block made. 
2nd row: Ch 6. 1 dc in 4th ch 
from hook. 1 dc in each of next 
2 ch – beg block made. (Sl st. Ch 3. 
3 dc) in next ch-3 sp – block made. 
Turn. 2 blocks.
3rd row: Beg block. *Block in 
next ch-3 sp. Rep from * to end of 
row. Turn. 3 blocks.
First 3 rows of Chart complete. 
Keeping cont of color changes 
in Chart (each square on grid 
represents 1 block), rep last 
row until 31st row of Chart is 
complete. 31 blocks.
Keeping cont of Chart, proceed as 
follows to work sides even:
32nd row: Beg block. *Block in 
next ch-3 sp. Rep from * to last 
ch-3 sp. Sl st in last ch-3 sp. (Do 
not make a block.) Turn.
33rd row: Sl st in each of first 
3 dc. *Block in next ch-3 sp. Rep 
from * to end of row. Turn.
34th to 45th rows: Rep last 
2 rows 6 times more.
Keeping cont of Chart, proceed as 
follows to dec corner:
46th row: Sl st in each of first 3 dc. 
*Block in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * 
to last ch-3 sp. Sl st in last ch-3 sp. 
(Do not make a block.) Turn.
Keeping cont of Chart, rep last 
row until 1 block rem. Fasten off.
FINISHING
With D and yarn needle, whipstitch 
top of Tapestry to dowel.

materials: Caron® x Pantone™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 127 yds/116 m) Ocean Surf (01008) 1 braid
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 5" [12.5 cm] diameter, excluding fringe.
gauge: 12 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes:
• Before working with Caron® x Pantone™ multi-shade yarn braid, separate each color link and wind into 5 separate balls.
• Each color link will be referenced by its Pantone # (see ball band).
• Designate each different shade of the 5 separate yarn balls as Contrast A, B, C, D and E as noted in Materials section (or as desired).
• Due to finite amount of yarn in each shade, pattern gauge must be matched to ensure successful results.
• Each link will make one wall hanging.

WALL HANGING (make 1 with each color link)

Top of Hoop: 1st row: (RS). Work 16 sc in hoop. Fasten off.
Bottom of Hoop: Work as for Top of Hoop.

With WS facing, pivot Top and Bottom rows of sc to inside of Hoop so RS of sts are facing (see Weaving Diagram). 
Weaving: Cut one strand of yarn 180" [457.5 cm] long. With RS facing, secure one end of strand to right-most st at bottom (1A in diagram). With tapestry needle, weave strand down through left-most st at top (1B in diagram), up through next st at bottom (2A), down through next st at top (2B), pulling strand tightly (see diagram). Cont in this manner until all sts have been woven into.

Hanging Loop: Work 1 sc in 8th sp at Top of Hoop (sp between 8th and 9th sc). Ch 20. Sl st in first sc to form Hanging Loop. Fasten off.

Fringe: Cut 15 strands of yarn 24" [61 cm] long. Taking 1 strand, fold in half and knot into fringe in every sp between sc across Bottom of Hoop. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream™ (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Contrast A Ecru (00004)  1 ball or 57 yds/52 m
Contrast B Black (00002)  1 ball or 11 yds/10 m
Contrast A Black (00002)  1 ball or 57 yds/52 m
Contrast B Ecru (00004)  1 ball or 11 yds/10 m
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
40" [101.5 cm] length of 1/4" [6 mm] wide faux leather cording.
measurements: To fit plant pot 4½" [11.5 cm] diameter.
gauge: 15 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 4 sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 48 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 5 sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 56 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
9th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
10th rnd: Ch 4 (counts as tr). 1 tr in each sc around. Join with sl st to top of ch 4.
11th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each tr around. Join with sl st to first sc.
12th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep 10th to 12th rnds once more, then 10th rnd once more. Break A. Join B.
Next 2 rnds: With B, as 11th and 12th rnds.
Next rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right, instead of from right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Thread ends of faux leather cord through last row of reverse sc at either side edge of Hanger. Tie tightly to secure.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each of 316 Soft White A, 321 Gold B, 256 Carrot C, 378 Claret D, and 389 Hunter Green E
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 5.5 mm [US I-9] and 3.75 mm [US F-5]
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C etc
measurements: Each square of banner measures about 4” (10 cm) wide and 4½” (11.5 cm) tall.
gauge: 12 sts = about 4” (10 cm); 15 rows = 4” (10 cm) in single crochet with larger hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SQUARE (make 20)
With larger hook and A, ch 12.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across—11 sc.
Rows 2–11: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Row 12 (eyelet row): Ch 1, turn, sc in first sc, ch 2, skip next 2 sc (eyelet made), sc in next 5 sc, ch 2, skip next 2 sc (eyelet made), sc in last sc—7 sc and 2 ch-2 spaces.
Row 13: Ch 1, turn, sc in first sc, 2 sc in next ch-2 space, sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next ch-2 space, sc in last sc—11 sc.
Fasten off.

ROPE #1
With larger hook and C, work a chain about 45” (114.5 cm) long.
Row 1: Slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across. Fasten off.

ROPE #2
With larger hook and C, work a chain about 60” (152.5 cm) long.
Row 1: Slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Weave in ends.
Surface Slip Stitch
With smaller hook and following charts and color table, work surface slip stitch (see Special Technique) letters on 10 squares and leave 10 squares blank.

Join and Edge Pairs of Squares
Hold a lettered square in front of a blank square, with letter facing and stitches of both pieces matching. With larger hook and working through both thicknesses, draw up a loop of B in first sc of Row 13, sc in each sc across Row 13, ch 1, sc in end of each row across side edge, ch 1, sc in base of each sc across bottom of Row 1, ch 1, sc in end of each row across other side edge, ch 1; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off. Repeat to join and edge all remaining squares.

ASSEMBLY
Thread letters for “GIVE” onto Rope #1. Thread letters for “THANKS” onto Rope #2. Weave in any remaining ends.

materials: RED HEART® With Love®: 1 skein each 1101 Eggshell A and 1012 Black B
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Skeleton measures 22” [56 cm] long
gauge: 16 sc = 4” [10 cm]; 14 rows = 4” [10 cm] in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Hanging Skeleton
Crochet a spooky skeleton and add hand-crafted style to your Halloween décor. He’s perfect for greeting trick-or-treaters at your front door!

Note: Pieces are worked in continuous rounds. Place stitch marker for beginning of round. When changing colors, work last step of last st of previous color with new color. Carry colors not in use loosely top of row, working sts over carried yarn to hide.

SPECIAL ABBREVIATIONS
sc2tog: [Draw up a loop in next st] twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.

SKELETON

SKULL
Starting at top of Skull, with A, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook – 6 sts. Place stitch marker for beginning of round.
Round 2: Working in continuous rounds, work 2 sc in each st around – 12 sts.
Round 3: [Sc in next st, 2 sc in next st] 6 times – 18 sts.
Round 4: [Sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st] 6 times – 24 sts.
Round 5: [Sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st] 6 times – 30 sts.
Round 6: [Sc in next 4 sts, 2 sc in next st] 6 times – 36 sts.
Rounds 7-12: Sc in each st around.
Round 13: [Sc2tog, sc in next 4 sts] 6 times – 30 sts.
Round 14: Repeat Round 7.
Round 15: [Sc in next 2 sts, sc2tog, sc in next st] 6 times – 24 sts.
Fasten off.

JAW
With A, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook – 6 sts. Place stitch marker for beginning of round.
Round 2: Working in continuous rounds, work 2 sc in each st around – 12 sts.
Round 3: [Sc in next st, 2 sc in next st] 6 times – 18 sts.
Round 4: [Sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st] 6 times – 24 sts.
Rounds 5-7: Sc in each st around.
Fasten off.

MOUTH (Make 2)
With B, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook – 6 sts. Place stitch marker for beginning of round.
Round 2: Working in continuous rounds, work 2 sc in each st around – 12 sts.
Round 3: [Sc in next st, 2 sc in next st] 6 times – 18 sts.
Round 4: [Sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st] 6 times – 24 sts.
Fasten off.

SKULL EYES (Make 2)
With B, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook – 6 sts. Fasten off.

SKULL NOSE
With B, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook – 2 sts.
Round 2: Sc in first sc, 2 sc in next st – 3 sts.  Fasten off.

BODY
Starting at Neck, with A, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook – 6 sts. Place stitch marker for beginning of round.
Round 2: Working in continuous rounds, [sc in next st, 2 sc in next st] 3 times – 9 sts.
Rounds 3-5: Sc in each st around.
Round 6: [Sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st] 3 times – 12 sts.
Round 7: [Sc in next st, 2 sc in next st] 6 times – 18 sts.
Round 8: [Sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st] 6 times – 24 sts.
Round 9: [Sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st] 6 times – 30 sts.
Round 10: Sc in each st around.
Round 11: Sc in first st, change to B, sc in next 13 sts, change to A, sc in next 2 sts, change to B, sc in next 13 sts, change to A, sc in last st of round. Cut B.
Rounds 12-13: With A, sc in each st around.
Round 14: Repeat Round 11.
Rounds 15-16: Repeat Round 12.
Round 17: Repeat Round 11.
Rounds 18-19: Repeat Round 12.
Round 20: Repeat Round 11.
Rounds 21-22: Repeat Round 12.
Round 23: [Sc in next 2 sts, sc2tog, sc in next st] 6 times – 24 sts.
Round 24: Repeat Round 10.
Fasten off.

ARM (Make 2)
Starting at shoulder, with A, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook – 6 sts. Place stitch marker for beginning of round.
Rounds 2-4: Sc in each st around.
Row 5: Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in next 5 sts, turn – 5 sts.
Rows 6-24: Repeat Row 5.
Rows 25-27: Ch 1, sc in each st across; turn.

Shape Fingers
Row 28: Ch 5, slip st in 2nd ch from hook, slip st in next 3 ch, slip st in first sc of Row 27, [sc in next sc, ch 5, slip st in 2nd ch from hook, slip st in next 3 ch, slip st in sc just worked] 4 times. Fasten off. 

Tie both sides of Arm together at Row 14 for elbow.

LEGS (Make 2)
Work as for Arm through Row 24.
Rows 25-26: Repeat Row 5.
Rows 27-29: Repeat Row 25.

Shape Toes
Row 30: Ch 3, slip st in 2nd ch from hook, slip st in next ch, slip in first sc of Row 29, [sc in next sc, ch 3, slip st in 2nd ch from hook, slip st in next ch, slip st in sc just worked] 4 times. Fasten off.

Tie both sides of Leg together at Row 14 for knee.

FINISHING
Fill Skull and Jaw with fiberfil. Sew one Mouth piece to last round of Skull and second Mouth piece to last round of Jaw. With Mouth pieces together, place Skull on top of Jaw. Sew 12 back sts together to join the Skull and Jaw. Leave front edge unsewn so Mouth will be slightly open.

Sew Eyes and Nose to front of Skull. With B and using straight stitches, sew teeth along edges of Mouth and Skull and Jaw. Add fiberfil to Skeleton Body. Sew bottom seam closed.

Sew Skull to Neck. Make a 3” [8 cm] chain. Fold in half and sew ends to top of Head for hanging loop.

Sew Arms to either side Skeleton Body.
Sew Legs to bottom of the Skeleton Body.
Weave in ends.

pattern_name: ROUND IN CIRCLES CROCHET WALL HANGING
materials: Bernat® Super Value™ (7 oz/197 g; 426 yds/389 m)
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
7" [18 cm] wide piece of cardboard for Tassels.
measurements: Approx 28" [71 cm] square (excluding tassels).
gauge: Circle = 4" [10 cm] diameter.
instructions:
Circles (Make 9 with A, 12 with B, and 15 with C).
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnds does not count as hdc.
Ch 3.
1st rnd: 10 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first hdc. 10 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 20 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 30 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 2 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 40 hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 3 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 50 hdc. Fasten off.
Join Circles as shown in diagram on page 2.
FINISHING
Tassels (make 2 each with A, B, and C).
Wrap yarn around a 7" [18 cm] piece of cardboard 30 times. Tie securely at one end. Cut across other end. Wrap yarn 6 times around tassel 1½" [4 cm] from tied end, and fasten securely. Attach tassels to bottom of Wall Hanging as shown in picture.
Ties: With A, ch 13. Sl st in center st of Circle. Ch 13. Fasten off. Rep at top of each Circle across top edge.
Attach Wall Hanging to wood dowel with Ties as shown in picture.

pattern_name: Mini Mock Rame Crochet Wall Hanging
materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
8" [20.5 cm] piece of cardboard for tassels.
abbreviations: Trbp3tog = [(Yoh) twice and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice] 3 times. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.

Trbp6tog = [(Yoh) twice and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice] 6 times. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 10" x 10" [25.5 x 25.5 cm], excluding tassels.
gauge: 15 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions: Note: Wall hanging is worked from the top down. With MC, ch 53. See diagram on page 2. 1st row: (RS). 3 tr in 5th ch from hook (skipped ch-4 counts as tr). Ch 1. Skip next 5 ch. 1 sc in next ch. Ch 1. Skip next 5 ch. *(3 tr. Ch 3. 3 tr) in next ch. Ch 1. Skip next 5 ch. 1 sc in next ch. Ch 1. Skip next 5 ch. Rep from * to last ch. 4 tr in last ch. Turn. 2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first tr. *Ch 5. Trbp6tog around next 6 tr (skipping center ch-1, sc and ch-1). Ch 5. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * ending last rep with 1 sc in top of ch-4. Turn. 3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 1. (3 tr. Ch 3. 3 tr) in top of next Trbp6tog. Ch 1. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 4th row: Ch 4 (counts as tr). Trbp3tog around next 3 tr. Ch 5. *1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 5. Trbp6tog around next 6 tr (skipping center ch-1, sc and ch-1). Ch 5. Rep from * to last ch-3 sp. 1 sc in last ch-3 sp. Ch 5. Trbp3tog around last 3 tr. 1 tr in last sc. Turn. 5th row: Ch 4 (counts as tr). 3 tr in first tr. Ch 1. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 1. *(3 tr. Ch 3. 3 tr) in next Trbp6tog. Ch 1. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 1. Rep from * to last tr. 4 tr in last tr. Turn. 6th row: As 2nd row. 7th row: As 3rd row. 8th row: Sl st in each st to first ch-3 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 5. Trbp6tog around next 6 tr (skipping center ch-1, sc and ch-1). Ch 5. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * to end of row (leaving last 3 tr, ch-1 and sc unworked). Turn. 9th row: As 3rd row. 10th to 13th rows: As 8th and 9th rows twice more. Fasten off. Border: Turn work upside down with RS facing. Join MC with sl st to top right corner of Wall Hanging at foundation ch. 1st rnd: Ch 1. Work sc evenly around all sides of Wall Hanging having 2 sc at points where sides begin to decrease and 3 sc in each corner and at bottom point. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. Tassels: Make 1 each in A, B, C, D and E. Wind yarn around 8" [20.5 cm] wide piece of cardboard 20 times. Tie length of yarn loosely through loops at one end to temporarily secure. Cut across opposite end. Tie length of yarn tightly around Tassel 2" [5 cm] down from tied end to create Tassel Loop. Using tapestry needle and 2 strands of F, carefully wrap yarn tightly around Tassel Loop covering all contrast color below and removing temporary tie. Fasten securely. FINISHING: Sew Wall Hanging to dowel with whip st as seen in picture. Sew Tassels to bottom of Wall Hanging as shown in picture.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
¼” [25 mm] wooden dowel, approx 18" [45.5 cm] long.
7" [18 cm] wide piece of cardboard for tassels.
abbreviations: Sc2(3)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2(3) sitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 13" [33 cm] wide x 17" [43 cm] long, excluding tassels.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
With A, ch 46. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from 
hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of 
chain. Turn. 45 sc. 
2nd to 10th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in 
each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Next (joining) row: Fold work 
so foundation ch is aligned with 
next row. Ch 1. Working through 
both thicknesses, work 1 sc in each 
sc and rem loop of foundation ch 
to end of row to form top casing. 
Turn. 
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to 
end of row. Turn. 
Rep last row 41 times more, for a 
total of 42 rows from joining row. 
Dec rows: 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 
Sc3tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 3 sc. 
Sc3tog. Turn. 41 sts. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to 
end of row. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 1. Sc3tog. 1 sc in each 
sc to last 3 sts. Sc3tog. Turn. 37 sts. 
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to 
end of row. Turn. 
Rep last 2 rows to 5 sts. 
Next row: (RS). Sc3tog. Sc2tog. 
2 sts. 
Next row: Sc2tog. Fasten oﬀ. 
FINISHING
Following chart, cross stitch words 
onto front of Banner, using colors 
as indicated, beg 4 rows down 
from joining row. Each square on 
chart represents 1 sc.
Hanging Cord: With B, ch 50. 
Fasten oﬀ. 
Insert dowel through top casing. 
Tie Hanging Cord to dowel at 
either side of Banner as shown. 
Tassels (make 1 each with B, C and 
D)
Cut a piece of cardboard 7" [18 cm] 
wide. Wind B around cardboard 
25 times. Break yarn leaving a 
long end and thread end through 
needle. Slip needle through all 
loops and tie tightly. Remove 
cardboard and wind yarn tightly 
around loops 1" [2.5 cm] below 
fold. Fasten securely. Cut through 
rem loops and trim ends evenly. 
Sew 1 Tassel to each point of 
Banner as shown.

materials: Bernat® Maker Big™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 66 yds/60 m) Amber (25009) 4 balls
Size U.S. P/Q/19 (15 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Popcorn = Work 4 dc into same stitch. Drop loop from hook. Insert hook from front to back into first dc of 4 dc group. Pull dropped loop through stitch. Ch 1 to secure popcorn.
measurements: Approx 27" [68.5 cm] wide x 48" [122 cm] long, including fringe.
gauge: 4 sts and 2.5 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Note: Ch 3 at beg of row counts as ddc.
Push Popcorns from WS to RS.
Ch 7.
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. 1 dc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 5 dc.
2nd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. 1 dc in each dc to last dc. 2 dc in last dc. Turn. 7 dc.
3rd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Popcorn in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 2 dc in last dc. Turn. 9 sts.
4th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first st. 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. Popcorn in next st. 1 dc in next st. Popcorn in next st. 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. 2 dc in last st. Turn. 11 sts.
5th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first st. 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. *Popcorn in next st. 1 dc in next st. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 dc in next st. 2 dc in last st. Turn. 13 sts.
6th to 12th rows: Rep 5th row. 27 sts at end of 11th row.
13th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. *Popcorn in next st. 1 dc in next st. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 dc in each of last 2 sts. Turn. 27 sts.
14th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in next st. *Popcorn in next st. 1 dc in next st. Rep from * to last st. 1 dc in last st. Turn.
15th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each st to end of row. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Fringe: Cut lengths of yarn 48" [122 cm] long. Taking 1 strand, fold in half and knot into fringe along entire bottom edge of Wall Hanging. Trim fringe as shown in picture.
Using whip st, attach Wall Hanging to wooden dowel.
Fringe: Cut yarn 10 to 14 ins [25.5 to 35.5 cm] long. Taking 2 or 3 strands together for each fringe knot into fringe across cast on and cast off edges. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: Caron® Cakes™ (7.1 oz/200 g; 383 yds/350 m) Cinnamon Swirl (17031) 3 balls
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx. 30" x 32" [76 x 81.5 cm] (excluding rod or stick).
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Motif (make 18)
Ch 6. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring. See Motif diagram on page 2.
1st rnd: Ch 3 (counts as 1 dc). 15 dc in ring. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 16 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in next dc. *(1 sc. Ch 7. 1 sc) in next dc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to last 2 dc. (1 sc. Ch 7. 1 sc) in next dc. 1 sc in next dc. Join with sl st to first dc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *(2 hdc. 17 dc. 2 hdc) in next ch-7 sp.** Skip next 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around, ending last rep at **. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Join Motifs tog in a rectangle, 6 Motifs wide by 3 Motifs high, as shown.
Lower Edging and Fringe
Note: Red dc symbols shown on Motif diagram indicate lowest dc stitches referenced in the following text.
With RS facing, join yarn with sl st in first of 2 lower dc stitches on far right of bottom Motif (see red dc symbols on diagram). Sl st in next dc beside last dc. Ch 7. Sl st into each of lower 2 sts on left side of same Motif. *Ch 7. Sl st into each of lower 2 sts on right side of next Motif. Ch 7. Sl st into each of lower 2 sts on left side of same Motif. Rep from * 4 times more across rem of lower edge. Turn.
1st row: Ch 1. Work 1 sc in each sl st or ch to end of row. Turn. 101 sts.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each dc to end of row. Fasten off.
Fringe: Cut lengths of yarn 30" [76 cm] long. Taking 3 strands tog, fold in half and knot into fringe, spacing each fringe 2 sts apart. Work 1 row of fringe across 2nd and 3rd rows to create double layer of fringe. Trim evenly.
Bottom Pompoms and Tassels
Pompoms (make 6): Wind yarn around 4 fingers 80 times. Tie tightly in the middle. Cut loops at both ends and trim to smooth round shape. 
Optional: Make 6 large pompons using pompom maker.
Small Tassels: (make 6)
Cut a piece of cardboard 6" [15 cm] wide. Wind yarn around cardboard 50 times.
Break yarn, leaving a long end. Thread end through a needle. Slip needle through all loops and tie tightly. Remove cardboard and wind yarn tightly around loops ¾" [2 cm] below fold. Fasten securely. Cut through rem loops and trim ends evenly. Fasten tassel to pompom by running long end of yarn through center of pompom. Join pompoms along 1st row of lower edging, centered under each Motif.
Top Edge and Loops
Note: Red dc symbols shown on Motif diagram indicate top dc stitches referenced in the following text.
Ch 7. With RS facing, join yarn with sl st in first of 2 top dc stitches on far right of top Motif (see red dc symbols on diagram). Sl st in next dc beside last dc. Ch 7. Sl st into each of top 2 sts on left side of same Motif. *Ch 7. Sl st into each of top 2 sts on right side of next Motif. Ch 7. Sl st into each of top 2 sts on left side of same Motif. Rep from * 4 times more across rem of top edge. Turn.
1st row: Ch 8. Work 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and 1 sc in each ch and sl st to end of row. Turn. 115 sc. 
2nd row: With yarn held double, ch 20. 2 sl st in previous row directly above top 2 sts of top right Motif. Ch 20. 2 sl st in previous row directly above top 2 sts at left side of same Motif. *Ch 20. 2 sl st in previous row directly above top right 2 sts of next Motif. Ch 20. 2 sl st in previous row directly above top 2 sts at left side of same Motif. Rep from * across top edge, ending with ch 20. Join with sl st in last sc. Fasten off.
Large Tassels (make 2)
Cut a piece of cardboard 7" [18 cm] wide. Wind yarn around cardboard 60 times.
Break yarn, leaving a long end.
Thread end through a needle. Slip needle through all loops and tie tightly. Remove cardboard and wind yarn tightly around loops ¾" [2 cm] below fold. Fasten securely. Join 1 Tassel at each end of Top edge as shown.
Thread rod or stick through ch-20 loops as shown.

materials: RED HEART Mixology Prints™: 1 ball 969 Moonlit Print A
RED HEART Mixology Swirl™: 1 ball 9969 Moonlit B
RED HEART Mixology Solids™: 1 ball each 10 White C and 12 Black D
RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein 341 Light Grey E
¼” diameter x 12” long (6 mm x 30.5 cm) dowel or stick
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
measurements: Wall hanging measures 6½” wide and 10” long (16.5 x 25.5 cm).
gauge: 6 sts = 4” (10 cm); 4 rows = 4” (10 cm) in double crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Lower Section
With A, ch 11.
Row 1 (right side): Hdc in 3rd ch from hook (beginning ch count as first hdc) and in each ch across, turn—10 hdc.
Row 2: Ch 2 (counts as first hdc here and throughout), hdc in each st; change to B, turn. Cut A.
First Block
Row 3: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in next 3 sts; leave remaining stitches unworked, turn—4 dc.
Rows 4 and 5: Ch 3, dc in each st, turn. Remove hook and place stitch on marker.
2nd Block
Row 3 (right side): With right side facing, join C with slip st in first unworked st of Row 3 of first side, ch 3, dc in each unworked st, turn—4 dc.
Rows 4 and 5: Ch 3, dc in each st, turn.
Upper Section
Row 6 (wrong side): Ch 3, dc in next 4 sts, insert hook in next st, yarn over, pull up a loop, yarn over, draw through 2 loops, drop C, place B loop on hook and draw through 2 loops on hook, dc in last 4 sts; change to A, turn—10 dc. Cut B and C.
Rows 7–9: Ch 2, hdc in each st, turn.
Row 10: Repeat last row; change to B. Cut A.
Rows 11 and 12: Ch 2, hdc in each st, turn.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Refer to photograph as a guide for placement.
Fringe
Cut 12 strands of E, each 8” (20.5 cm) long; separate into 3 groups of 4 strands. Fold strands in half to form a loop. With right side facing, insert crochet hook from front to back and up to front again between first 2 stitches of Row 11. Place fold on hook and draw fold through, forming a loop. Thread ends of strands through loop and pull to tighten. Repeat to attach fringe between 2nd and 3rd stitches and between 3rd and 4th stitches. Trim ends evenly.
Hanging Loops
Cut 5 strands of E, each 8” (20.5 cm) long. Fold each strand in half and tie ends together with an overhand knot to form a loop. With right side and top edge facing, thread folded end of loop from front to back through first stitch of Row 12, open strands of hanging loop below knot and insert the folded end. Pull up the folded end so knotted end tightens around stitch. Repeat to join remaining 4 hanging loops in top of 3rd, 5th, 7th, and last stitches. Adjust as needed to place knots on wrong side. Weave in ends.
Insert dowel or stick through hanging loops and tie on twine for hanging.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein 319 Cherry Red A and 1 skein 316 Soft White B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 5mm [US H-8] and 6mm [US J-10]
measurements: Banner measures 70” (178 cm) long; Maple Leaf measures 7” (18 cm) high x 6.5” (16.5 cm) wide.
gauge: sc = 4” (10 cm) and 17 rows sc = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Leaf Center
With 5mm [US H-8] hook and A, ch 13.
Row 1: (Right side): Turn the foundation chain over and work into the back bar of each ch. Sc in the 2nd ch from hook and next 11 ch, ch 2, do not turn; working into the opposite side of the foundation chain and inserting the hook into the top two loops of each ch, sc in next 10 ch, ch 1; turn—12 sc, one ch-2 space, 10 sc.
Row 2: Sc in next 10 sc, (sc, ch 2, sc) in ch-2 space, sc in next 10 sc, ch 1; turn—11 sc, one ch-2 space, 11 sc.
Row 3: Sc in next 11 sc, (sc, ch 2, sc) in ch-2 space, sc in next 8 sc, ch 1; turn—12 sc, one ch-2 space, 9 sc.
Row 4: Sc in next 9 sc, (sc, ch 3, sc) in ch-2 space, sc in next 9 sc, ch 1; turn—10 sc, one ch-3 space, 10 sc.
Left Half
Row 1: Work into Row 4 of Leaf Center. Sc in next 5 sc, slip st in next sc, ch 1; turn—5 sc, slip st.
Row 2: Sc in blo of slip st, sc in next 2 sc, ch 3; turn—3 sc, ch-3.
Row 3: Skip first ch, sc in top loop only of next 2 ch, sc in next 3 sc, slip st in next sc (Leaf Center Row 4), ch 1; turn—5 sc, slip st.
Row 4: Sc in blo of slip st, sc in next 5 sc, ch 3; turn—6 sc, ch-3.
Right Half
Row 1: Work up right side of Leaf Center Row 4. Sc in next 7 sc, ch 3; turn—7 sc, ch-3.
Row 2: Skip first ch, sc in top loop only of next 2 ch, sc in next 3 sc, slip st in next sc (Right Half Row 1), ch 1; turn—5 sc, slip st.
Row 3: Sc in blo of slip st, sc in next 5 sc, ch 3; turn—6 sc, ch-3.
Row 4: Skip first ch, sc in top loop only of next 2 ch, sc in next 6 sc, slip st in next sc (Right Half Row 1), ch 1; turn—8 sc, slip st.
Row 5: Sc in blo of slip st, sc in next 6 sc, ch 1; turn—7 sc.
Row 6: Sc in next 7 sc, slip st in next sc (Right Half Row 1), ch 1; turn—7 sc, slip st.
Row 7: Sc in blo of slip st, sc in next 4 sc, ch 3; turn—5 sc, ch-3.
Row 8: Skip first ch, sc in top loop only of next 2 ch, sc in next 5 sc, slip st in next sc (Right Half Row 1), ch 1; turn—7 sc, slip st.
Row 9: Sc in blo of slip st, sc in next 4 sc, ch 1; turn—5 sc.
Bottom and Stem
Row 1: Work across both sides of the Leaf. Sc in next 5 sc, slip st in blo of next 2 sc (Left Half Row 11), sc in next 3 sc, ch 1; turn—5 sc, 2 slip sts, 3 sc.
Row 2: Sc in next 3 sc, slip st in blo of next 2 slip sts, sc in next 3 sc, ch 1; turn—3 sc, 2 slip sts, 3 sc.
Row 3: Sc in next 3 sc, slip st in blo of next slip st, ch 10, skip 5 ch, slip st in back bar of next 5 ch, slip st in next slip st. Fasten off and weave in ends.
BANNER CHAIN
With 6mm [US J-10] hook and B, ch 225. Fasten off and weave in ends.
FINISHING
Block Leaves if desired. String Banner Chain through the loops of the Maple Leaf Stems and sew Leaves to Chain, referring to photo for placement.

materials: 3 balls RED HEART® Classic Crochet Thread size 10: 420 Cream
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Runner measures 26¾” wide x 15¼” deep.
gauge: 23 sts = 2”; 9 rows = 2” in dc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size needles/hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
RUNNER
Starting at left side, ch 180. 
Row 1 (Right Side): Dc in 4th ch from hook, dc in each ch across (59 blocks made), turn. 
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), dc in next 3 dc (block made), *ch 2, skip next 2 sts, dc in next dc; repeat from * 56 times, dc in last 3 dc (57 spaces with 1 block on each end), turn. 
Rows 3-125: Continue to work in blocks and spaces following chart. Fasten off. 
NOTE: We have included a charted alphabet (both upper and lower case letters) to plan your personalized design. Using graph paper, position your letters and border as desired before you begin.
HOW TO READ FILET PATTERN CHART:
Each square in your chart represents either a “block” (•) or a “space” (open square). 
For “block” = dc in next dc, dc in next 2 sts or ch-2 space, dc in next dc. 
For “space” = dc, ch 2, skip next 2 sts, dc. 
The dc at the end of each square also counts as the first dc of the next block or space. For example, a block followed by a space = dc in next 4 sts, ch 2, skip next 2 sts, dc in next dc.
When following chart, odd number rows are worked right to left and even number rows are worked from left to right.
Create a thread crochet table runner or wall hanging with any letters you wish. This lacy piece is done with the filet crochet technique using a chart to plan your design.

materials: Bernat® Baby Velvet™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 492 yds/450 m)
Contrast B Ever After Pink (86020) 1 ball
Size U.S. G/6 [4 mm] crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
2¼" [0.5 cm] diameter dowels cut to 12" [30.5 cm].
abbreviations: Beg Bobble = Ch 3. (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Bobble = (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times in indicated sp. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Sc2tog = Yoh and draw up a loop in each of next 2 sts. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Sheep = Approx 4½" [11.5 cm] long.
gauge: 14 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Join each rnd with sl st to first st.

SHEEP (make 5)
With B, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join.12 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 4. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Ch 4. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Join A with sl st to back loop only of first st. Break B.
5th rnd: With A, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
6th rnd: Working in both loops, beg Bobble in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 dc. *Bobble in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. Bobble in next sc. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Bobble in next sc. Rep from * around. Join.
9th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
10th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *Bobble in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join.
11th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
12th rnd: Beg Bobble in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. *Bobble in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join.
13th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. 18 sc. Join.
14th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. Bobble in next sc. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Bobble in next sc. Rep from * around. Join.
15th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * around. 12 sc. Join.
Stuff Sheep.
16th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 6 sc. Fasten off. Thread end through rem sts and cinch tightly.

Legs (make 4 per Sheep)
With B, ch 5.
1st row: Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. Sl st in each of next 3 ch.
Fasten off.

Hearts (make 10)
With B, ch 2.
1st rnd: 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. (1 hdc. 1 dc. 1 tr. 1 dc. 1 hdc) in next sc. Sl st in next sc. (1 hdc. 1 dc. 1 tr. 1 dc. 1 hdc) in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Ch 2. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. Join. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Sew 4 Legs to each Sheep as seen in picture. Cut 5 lengths of monofilament fish line approx 15" [38 cm] long. Thread 2 Hearts and one Sheep on each thread and tie to dowels as seen in picture.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® O’Go™ (Solids: 7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m; Prints: 5 oz/141 g; 236 yds/215 m)
Size U.S 7 (4.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Bobble = (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 5 times in indicated stitch. Yoh and draw through all 6 loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 8¾" x 9¼" [22 x 23.5 cm].
gauge: 14 sc and 17 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes: 
• When joining new color, work to last loops on hook. Draw new color through last loops, then proceed in new color.
• Carry color when not in use loosely across top of row and work sts around it to avoid stranding.
• Ch 1 at beg of each row.
• To begin working with the O’Go format, carefully cut plastic tie where the ends.
• Pull tie to remove.
• Start crocheting!
WALL HANGING
With MC, ch 30. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 29 sc.
2nd to 6th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
7th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 14 sts. With A, Bobble. With MC, 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 12 sts. With A, 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. With MC, 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
9th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 11 sts. With A, Bobble. (1 sc in next st. Bobble) 3 times. With MC, 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
First 9 rows of Chart are complete. Cont working Chart, reading RS rows from right to left and WS rows from left to right, until all 37 rows of Chart are complete. Do not fasten off. Do not turn at end of last row.
Edging: 1st rnd: (RS). With MC, ch 1. Work sc evenly around edges of Wall Hanging, working 3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Trace Wall Hanging onto cardboard and cut out. With spray adhesive or hot glue, glue cardboard to WS of Wall Hanging. Cut and glue lengths of MC to cover outer edges of Wall Hanging as needed.
Cut length of MC 12" [30.5 cm] long. Tie each end to top of Wall Hanging for hanging cord.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 4 skeins 316 Soft White A
RED HEART® Holiday®: 2 balls 6060 Green/Green D
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 4.25 mm [US G-6] and 6 mm [US J-10]
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Wall Hanging measures 24” wide x 30” long (61 x 76 cm)
gauge: 4 sc = 1” (2.5 cm); 4 rows = 1” (2.5 cm) with smaller hook; 8 dc = 3½” (9 cm); 6 rows = 3½” (9 cm) with larger hook and 2 strands held together. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Backdrop
With larger hook and 2 strands of A held together, ch 62.
Row 1 (wrong side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across, turn—61 sc.
Row 2 (right side): Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in each st, turn—62 dc.
Row 3: Ch 1, skip first st, *dc in next st, slip st in next st; repeat from * across working last slip st in top of beginning ch, turn.
Row 4: Ch 3, dc in each st across, turn.
Rows 5–58: Repeat last 2 rows 27 times.
Row 59: Repeat Row 3. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Lower Edging 
Row 1 (right side): With right side of Row 1 facing and working in opposite side of foundation ch, join 2 strands of B with sc in first ch, sc in each ch across, turn—61 sts.
Row 2: Ch 3, dc in each st across; change to C, turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each st across; change to B, turn.
