Row 4: Repeat Row 2.

Row 5: Ch 1, sc in first st, *skip next 2 sts, fan in next st, skip next 2 sts, sc in next st; repeat from * across. Fasten off.

Tree
Bottom section
With larger hook and 2 strands of D held together, ch 25.
Row 1 (wrong side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across, turn—24 sc.
Row 2: Ch 3, 2 dc in next st, *dc in next st, 2 dc in next st; repeat from * across, turn—36 dc.
Rows 3–7: Ch 3, dc in each st across, turn.
Rows 8–11: Ch 3, dc in first st (base of ch 3), dc in each st to beginning ch, 2 dc in top of beginning ch, turn—44 dc.
Row 12: Ch 1, sc in first st, *skip next 2 sts, fan in next st, skip next 2 sts, sc in next st; repeat from * across. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Middle section 
With larger hook and 2 strands of D held together, ch 19. 
Rows 1–4: Repeat Rows 1–4 of bottom section—27 dc.
Rows 5–12: Repeat Row 8 of bottom section—43 dc.
Row 13: Repeat Row 12 of bottom section. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Top section
With larger hook and 2 strands of D held together, ch 4. 
Row 1 (right side): Work 5 dc in 4th ch from hook (beginning ch count as first dc), turn—6 dc.
Row 2: Ch 3, dc in each st across, turn.
Row 3: Ch 3, dc in next st, 2 dc in next 2 sts, dc in last 2 sts, turn—8 dc.
Row 4: Ch 3, dc in each st across, turn.
Row 5: Ch 3, dc in next 2 sts, 2 dc in next 2 sts, dc in last 3 sts, turn—10 dc.
Row 6: Ch 3, dc in next 3 sts, 2 dc in next 2 sts, dc in last 4 sts, turn—12 dc.
Row 7: Ch 3, dc in next 4 sts, 2 dc in next 2 sts, dc in last 5 sts, turn—14 dc.
Row 8: Ch 3, dc in each st across, turn.
Rows 9–15: Repeat Row 8 of bottom section—28 dc.
Row 16: Repeat Row 12 of bottom section. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Tree Base
With smaller hook and E, ch 17.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—16 sc.
Rows 2–22: Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each st, turn. 
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Star
With smaller hook and F, ch 2.
Round 1 (right side): Work 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook—5 sc. Do not join.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each st; join with slip st in first sc—10 sc.
Round 3: Ch 3, dc in same st as join, 2 dc in each remaining st around; join with slip st in first sc—20 sc.
Round 4: *Ch 6, slip st in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next ch, hdc in next ch, dc in next ch, tr in last ch, skip next 3 sts, slip st in next st; repeat from * 4 times; join with slip st in first ch of beginning ch. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Stocking (make 12) 
Make 2 stockings in each of the following color sequences:
Stocking 1: 8 rounds with B, 4 rounds with G
Stocking 2: 8 rounds with G, 4 rounds with B 
Stocking 3: all rounds with H
Stocking 4: 9 rounds with C, 3 rounds with A
Stocking 5: 5 rounds with E, 3 rounds with C, 4 rounds with A
Stocking 6: [2 rounds with C, 1 round with E] 3 times, 3 rounds with E
With smaller hook, ch 6.
Round 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 3 ch, 3 sc in last ch; working in opposite side of foundation ch, skip first ch, sc in next 3 ch, 2 sc in last ch—12 sc. Do not join. Place marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed.

Round 2: Work 2 sc in first st, sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next 3 sts, sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in last 2 sts—18 sc.
Rounds 3 and 4: Sc in each st around.
Round 5: Sc in first 3 sts, [sc2tog] 6 times, sc in last 3 sts—12 sc.
Rounds 6–11: Sc in each st around.
Round 12: Working in front loops only, loosely slip st in each st around, (slip st, ch 6, slip st) in first slip st (hanging loop made). Fasten off tightly.

Mitten (make 12) 
Make 2 mittens in each of the following color sequences:
Mitten 1: all rounds with H
Mitten 2: [2 rounds with E, 2 rounds with A] 3 times
Mitten 3: 4 rounds with C, 1 round with B, 1 round with C, 1 round with B, 5 rounds with C
Mitten 4: 4 rounds with G, 3 rounds with C, 5 rounds with G
Mitten 5: 5 rounds with E, 3 rounds with C, 4 rounds with A
Mitten 6: 4 rounds with B, 1 round with A, 1 round with [next 2 sts with B, next st with A] around, 1 round with [next st with B, next 2 sts with A] around, 5 rounds with B
With smaller hook, ch 2.
Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc. Do not join. Place marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each st around—12 sc.
Round 3: Sc in each st around.
Round 4: *Sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * twice—15 sc.
Rounds 5–7: Sc in each st around.
Round 8: Sc in next 7 sts, 5 dc in front loop of next st, sc in next 7 sts—14 sc and 5 dc.
Round 9: Sc in next 7 sts; working in back loops only, sc5tog (thumb made), sc in next 7 sts—15 sc.
Round 10: Sc in each st around.
Round 11: *Sc in next 3 sts, sc2tog; repeat from * twice—12 sc.
Round 12: Repeat Round 12 of stocking.

FINISHING
Fold last 3 rows of backdrop to wrong side and sew across long edge to form a rod pocket.
Use photograph as a guide for placement of all pieces. Weave in ends.
Arrange stockings and mittens on tree sections as follows: 9 pieces on each of bottom and middle sections and 6 pieces on top section. Pin a safety pin or marker where each button will be sewn. Sew all buttons in place.
With rows positioned vertically, center lower edge of tree base on Row 2 of backdrop and sew in place. Slightly overlap bottom section of tree on top edge of tree base, pin in place and sew. Repeat to attach middle and top sections, overlapping previously sewn section.
Sew star on top section. Hang stockings and mittens on buttons. Weave in any remaining ends. Insert wooded rod and tie on rick rack for hanging.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 316 Soft White A, 312 Black B and 254 Pumpkin C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5 mm [US I-9]
abbreviations: sc2tog: [draw up a loop in next st] twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
sc3tog: [draw up a loop in next st] 3 times, yarn over and draw through all 4 loops on hook.

instructions:
Enchant your guests with a crocheted party banner in a sophisticated color scheme. It’s great for accenting the mantel or anywhere the spirit moves you.

Row 13: Join A, ch 2, hdc in base of ch-2, sc2tog, sc in next 3 sts, 3 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts, sc2tog, 2 hdc in last st, turn — 15 sts.
Row 14: Ch 2, hdc in base of ch-2, sc3tog, sc in next 3 sts, 3 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts, sc3tog, 2 hdc in last st, drop A, turn — 15 sts.
Row 15: Join B, ch 2, 2 hdc in base of ch-2, sc3tog, sc in next 3 sts, 3 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts, sc3tog, 3 hdc in last st, turn — 17 sts.
Row 16: Ch 2, hdc in base of ch-2, sc in next st, sc3tog, sc in next 3 sts, 3 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts, sc3tog, sc in next st, 2 hdc in last st, drop B, turn — 17 sts.
Row 17: Join A, ch 2, 2 hdc in base of ch-2, sc in next st, sc3tog, sc in next 3 sts, 3 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts, sc3tog, sc in next st, 3 hdc in last st, turn — 19 sts.
Row 18: Ch 2, hdc in base of ch-2, sc in next 2 sts, sc3tog, sc in next 3 sts, 3 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts, sc3tog, sc in next 2 sts, 2 hdc in last st, drop A, turn — 19 sts.
Row 19: Join B, ch 1, sc in first st, hdc in next st, dc in next st, tr in next 3 sts, dc in next st, hdc in next 2 sts, sc in next st, hdc in next 2 sts, dc in next st, tr in next 3 sts, dc in next st, hdc in next st, sc in last st, do not turn — 19 sts.
Edging Round: Ch 1, rotating piece, work sc evenly spaced around, working 3 sc at each corner.
Fasten off.

SOLID FLAG (make 3)
With C, ch 2.
Row 1: Work 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook, turn — 3 sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn —  3 sts.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn —  3 sts.
Note: Carry colors not in use loosely along side of work. 

SPECIAL ABBREVIATIONS
sc2tog: [draw up a loop in next st] twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
sc3tog: [draw up a loop in next st] 3 times, yarn over and draw through all 4 loops on hook.

CHEVRON FLAG (make 4)
With A, ch 2.
Row 1: 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook, turn — 3 sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first st, dc in next st, sc in last st, drop A, turn — 3 sts.
Row 3: Join B, ch 1, sc in first st, 3 sc in next st, sc in last st, turn — 5 sts.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc2tog, 3 sc in next st, sc2tog, drop B, turn — 5 sts.
Row 5: Join A, ch 1, sc in first 2 sts, 3 sc in next st, sc in last 2 sts, turn — 7 sts.
Row 6: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in next st, 3 sc in next st, sc in next st, sc2tog, drop A, turn — 7 sts.
Row 7: Join B, ch 1, sc in first 3 sts, 3 sc in next st, sc in last 3 sts, turn — 9 sts.
Row 8: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in next 2 sts, 3 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts, sc2tog, drop B, turn — 9 sts.
Row 9: Join A, ch 1, sc in first 4 sts, 3 sc in next st, sc in last 4 sts, turn — 11 sts.
Row 10: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in next 3 sts, 3 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts, sc2tog, drop A, turn — 11 sts.
Row 11: Join B, ch 1, sc in first 5 sts, 3 sc in next st, sc in last 5 sts, turn — 13 sts.
Row 12: Ch 2 (counts as first hdc here and throughout), sc2tog, sc in next 3 sts, 3 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts, sc2tog, hdc in last st, drop B, turn — 13 sts.
15 rows
crochet.

FINISHING
Tie
Row 1: With B, ch 16, *slip st across top of one Chevron Flag, ch 4, slip st across top of one Solid Flag, ch 4; repeat from * until one Chevron Flag remains, slip st across top of last Chevron Flag, ch 16.
Fasten off.
Weave in ends.

instructions:

9th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 7 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 7 hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 45 hdc.
10th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 8 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 8 hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 50 hdc.
11th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 9 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 9 hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 55 hdc.
12th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 10 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 10 hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 60 hdc.
13th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 11 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 11 hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 65 hdc.
14th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 12 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 12 hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 70 hdc.
15th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 13 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 13 hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 75 hdc.
16th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 14 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 14 hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 80 hdc.

Weaving
Cut 12 strands of yarn 40" [101.5 cm] long. Taking 4 strands tog, weave yarn in and out along sts on 21st, 23rd and 25th rows as shown in picture, taking care to not pull yarn too tightly.
Fringe
Cut strands of yarn 48" [122 cm] long. Taking 2 strands tog, fold in half and knot into fringe beg 26 sts in from left corner and ending 26 sts before right corner of Wall Hanging. Trim fringe evenly.
Using whip st, attach Wall Hanging to dowel.

materials: RED HEART® Anne Geddes Baby™: 2 balls 203 Daffodil A
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 4mm [US G-6] and 5mm [US H-8]
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Crown measures 8” [20.5 cm] diameter x 5” [12.5 cm] tall. Animals are 3¾” [9cm] tall.
gauge: 17 sc = 4” [10cm]; 19 rows = 4” [10cm] in single crochet using 4mm [US G-6] hook and 1 strand of yarn. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
FINISHING
With wrong side together, hold both Crowns together. Fold pieces so first and last Point are together, lining up edges. Holding 2 stands of A together and working through all layers, join yarn at first row and sc evenly alongside edges to join side seam. When side seam is joined, continue to sc evenly spaced along pointed lower edge, working 3 sc in each point, slip st in first st. Turn right side out. Stuff lightly with fiberfill. Insert embroidery hoop along top straight edge and sew top edge closed.

Border
With 2 strands of A held together and 5mm [US H-8] hook, ch 65. Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across – 64 sc. Row 2: Change to B, ch 1, turn, *sc in next sc, skip next sc, 5 dc in next sc, skip next sc; repeat from * across. Fasten off. Sew edges together. Sew around straight edge of Crown with B ruffles pointing towards Points.

ANIMAL
Make 4; 1 each in C, D, E and F
Animals are worked in continuous rounds. Place marker for beginning of round.

Head
With 1 strand of yarn and 4mm [US G-6] hook, ch 2. Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook, slip st in first st to join – 6 sc. Place marker for beginning of round. Round 2: 2 sc in each st around – 12 sc. Round 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] around – 18 sc.

CROWN
Make 2
With 2 strands of A held together and 5mm [US H-8] hook, ch 61. Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across – 60 sc. Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), turn, dc in each sc across. Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in each dc across. Row 4: Repeat Row 2.

Shape First Point
Row 5: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 10 dc, leave remaining sts unworked. Decrease Row: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in each st to last 2 sts, sc2tog – 8 sc. Next Row: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across. Repeat last 2 rows twice more – 4 sc. Next Row: Ch 1, turn, [sc2tog] twice – 2 sts. Last Row: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog. Fasten off.

Shape Next Point
*Join 2 strands of A held together in next unworked st on Row 4, ch 1, sc in same st, sc in next 9 sts. Decrease Row: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in last 2 sts, sc2tog – 8 sc. Next Row: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across. Repeat last 2 rows twice more – 4 sc. Next Row: Ch 1, turn, [sc2tog] twice – 2 sts. Last Row: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog. Fasten off. Repeat from * to make 4 more Points. 

Rounds 4-7: Sc in each sc around. Round 8: [Sc2tog] around – 9 sc. Round 9: Slip st loosely in each sc around. Round 10: 2 sc in each slip st around – 18 sc. Stuff Head with fiberfill. 

Shape Body
Round 11: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] around – 24 sc. Rounds 12-17: Sc in each sc around. Round 18: [Sc2tog] around – 12 sc. Stuff Body with fiberfill. Round 19: [Sc2tog] around – 6 sc. Fasten off. Weave yarn through sts and pull to gather. Knot to secure. Working from center of lower edge to halfway up Body, work backstitch through all layers to outline legs. Work a line of backstitch from one side edge up to shoulders for Arms. Repeat along opposite side.

BUNNY EARS
Make 2 for each Bunny
With 1 strand of same colored yarn and 4mm [US G-6] hook, ch 6. Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and next 3 chs, 5 sc in last ch, turn to work along opposite edge of foundation ch, sc in next 4 sts. Fasten off. Sew an Ear on either side of Head.

BEAR EARS
Make 2 for each Bear
With 1 strand of same colored yarn and 4mm [US G-6] hook, ch 2. Row 1: Work 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Fasten off. Sew an Ear on either side of Head.

BUNNY SNOUT
Make 1 for each Bunny
With 1 strand of B and 4mm [US G-6] hook, ch 2. Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook, slip st in first sc – 6 sc. Fasten off. Sew a French knot with matching yarn in center of Snout. Sew Snout in center of Head. With black embroidery floss, sew a French knot for each eye.

BEAR SNOUT
Make 1 for each Bear
With 1 strand of B and 4mm [US G-6] hook, ch 2. Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook, slip st in first sc – 6 sc. Round 2: 2 sc in each sc around, slip st in first sc – 12 sc. Fasten off. With black embroidery floss, sew a nose in center of Snout with satin stitch. Sew Snout in center of Head. With black embroidery floss, sew a French Knot for each eye.

Hanger
With 5mm [US H-8] hook, join 2 strands of B held together at top of one Animal Head, ch 15. Fasten off. Repeat to attach a Hanger to each Animal.

STAR
Make 8
With 2 strands of B held together and 5mm [US H-8] hook, ch 4, slip st in first ch to form a loop. Round 1: Ch 3, work 9 dc in ring, slip st in top of beginning ch – 10 dc. Round 2: *Ch 4, slip st in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next ch, hdc in last ch, skip next dc on Round 1, slip st in next dc; repeat from * 4 more times – 5 Points. 

Edging
With wrong sides together, hold 2 Stars together. Holding 2 stands of B together and working through both layers, join yarn in any st and sc evenly alongside edges, working 3 sc in each point, end at first st, slip st in first st. Repeat to make 4 joined Stars. 

Hanger
With 5mm [US H-8] hook, join 2 strands of B held together in between 2 Points, ch 15. Fasten off. Repeat to attach a Hanger to each Star. Attach 1 Star to another to make 2 strands of 2 Stars each. Arrange Stars and Animals around inside top edge of Crown and sew ends of Hangers in place. 

Mobile Hanger
Make 3
With 5mm [US H-8] hook and 2 strands of B held together, ch 30. Row 1: Slip st in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across. Fasten off. Arrange Mobile Hangers evenly spaced around top edge of Crown and sew one end of each in place. 

RING
With 1 strand of A and 4mm [US G-6] hook, work 24 sc around plastic ring, slip st in first sc to join. Sew opposite ends of Mobile Hangers to same spot on Ring. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 672 Spring Green A, 368 Paddy Green B, and 316 Soft White C
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Banner chain measures 60” (152.5 cm) long. Shamrock measures 6” long x 5½” wide (15 x 14 cm)
gauge: Gauge is not critical for project.
instructions: SHAMROCK (make 10) Leaf (make 30) With A, ch 2. Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in first st—6 sc. Round 2: Ch 1, sc in first st, (hdc, dc, tr, dc, hdc) in next st, sc in next st, (hdc, 2 dc) in next st, 3 dc in next st, (2 dc, hdc) in last st; join with slip st in first st—16 sts. Fasten off. Stem (make 10) With A, ch 15. Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch—13 sc. Fasten off. ASSEMBLY Border Notes Work all sts in back loops only and with right side of each leaf and stem facing. Take care not to twist piece as you work. Join C with slip st to first sc of leaf. Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, sc in same st as join, sc in next 2 sts, *sc in 2nd dc of next leaf, sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next 7 sts, sc in next 4 sts; repeat from * once; working across opposite side of foundation ch of stem, sc in first 6 ch, skip next 3 ch, sc in last 5 ch, [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 6 sc] twice; sc in next dc. FINISHING With B, work as many ch as needed for 60” (152.5 cm) or desired length. With yarn needle, thread chain through top back of center leaf of each shamrock motif. Space motifs evenly apart on chain. Weave in ends.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Each Flag measures approximately 4" [10 cm] wide x 3½" [9 cm] long.
gauge: 12 single crochet (sc) and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions: USING THIS GUIDE Click on the underlined words throughout the pattern to access our library of helpful tools. NOTES • Banner is made from triangular flags that are strung onto a long chain for hanging. • Each Flag is worked back and forth in rows from lower tip up to top edge. • Increases are worked at beginning (beg) and end of every other row to create triangular shape. SIZE Each Flag measures approximately (approx) 4" [10 cm] wide x 3½" [9 cm] long. BANNER Flags Make as many as desired using yarn colors of your choice. Make a slip knot and place it on the hook. Slip knot Make a loop with yarn and fold it on itself to make a pretzel shape. Then draw through to make slip knot. Chain (ch) 2. Yarn over hook (Yoh), draw through loop – 1 chain made. Repeat (rep) last step once more – 2 chains made. 1st row: 1 single crochet (sc) in second ch from hook. Turn. Insert hook into second ch from hook under the two top loops (do not count loop on hook as a chain); yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through both loops on hook – 1 sc made. Increasing Work 2 sc in indicated stitch. 2nd row: Ch 1. 3 sc in first sc. Turn. 3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 3 sc total. 4th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 5 sc total. 5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 5 sc total. 6th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 7 sc total. 7th to 12th rows: Repeat (rep) 5th and 6th rows 3 more times. 13 sc at end of 12th row. 13th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off. To permanently fasten off yarn, cut yarn leaving a long tail. Pull the end of yarn through loop on hook and pull gently to tighten. Repeat all the previous steps to make more triangular flags. Weave in all yarn tails. Hanging Chain Make a slip knot and place it on the hook. Make ch stitches until hanging chain measures approx 48" [122 cm] or desired length. Fasten off and weave in yarn tails. Finishing Use crochet hook to weave Hanging Chain through spaces between stitches at the top corners of Flags.

materials: RED HEART Mixology Solids™: 1 ball each 342 Taupe A and 530 Plum C
RED HEART Mixology Swirl™: 1 ball 9961 Renaissance B
RED HEART Mixology Prints™: 1 ball 961 Renaissance Print D
RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein 313 Aran E (Only a small quantity of E is needed for this project.)
Large eye yarn needle, ¼” diameter x 12” long (6 mm x 30.5 cm) dowel or stick and 1 yd (.91 m) twine
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
measurements: Wall hanging measures 6½” wide and 10” long (16.5 x 25.5 cm).
gauge: 6 sts = 4” (10 cm); 4 rows = 4” (10 cm) in double crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: redheart.com

Renaissance Crochet 
Wall Hanging
Choose your favorite combination of Mixology 
yarns for a crochet wall hanging. Designed at a 
beginner level of crochet, so you don’t need much 
experience to create this modern room accent. 
What you will need contnued: 
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 
9mm [US M-13]
Large eye yarn needle, ¼” diameter x 12” 
long (6 mm x 30.5 cm) dowel or stick and 1 
yd (.91 m) twine
GAUGE: 6 sts = 4” (10 cm); 4 rows = 4” 
(10 cm) in double crochet. CHECK YOUR 
GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the 
gauge.
Wall hanging measures 6½” wide and 10” 
long (16.5 x 25.5 cm).
Notes
1. Wall hanging is worked in turned rows.
2. To change color, work the last stitch to
last yarn over. Yarn over with new color
and draw through all loops on hook to
complete stitch. Drop old color to wrong
side and proceed with new color. Do not
cut any color until instructed.
WALL HANGING
With A, ch 11.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook 
and in each ch across, turn—10 sts.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and 
throughout), dc in each st, turn.
Row 3: Ch 3, dc in next 5 sts; change to B, 
drop A; dc in last 4 sts, turn.
Row 4: Ch 3, dc in next 4 sts; change to A, 
drop B; dc in last 5 sts; change to C, turn. 
Cut A.
Row 5: Ch 3, dc in next 3 sts; change to B, 
drop C; dc in last 6 sts, turn.
Row 6: Ch 3, dc in next 6 sts; change to C, 
drop B; dc in last 3 sts, turn.
Row 7: Ch 3; dc in next st; change to B, drop 
C; dc in last 8 sts, turn.
Row 8: Ch 3, dc in next 8 sts; change to C, 
drop B; dc in top of beginning ch; change to 
D, drop C; turn. Cut B and C.
Row 9: Ch 3, dc in each st, turn.
Row 10: Repeat Row 9; change to A. Cut D.
Row 11: Ch 2, hdc in each st. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Refer to photograph as a guide for 
placement.
Fringe
Cut 12 strands of E, each 8” (20.5 cm) long; 
separate into 3 groups of 4 strands. Fold 
strands in half to form a loop. With right 
side facing, insert crochet hook from front 
to back and up to front again between 
first 2 C-color stitches of Row 2. Place fold 
on hook and draw fold through, forming a 
loop. Thread ends of strands through loop 
and pull to tighten. Repeat to attach fringe 
between 2nd and 3rd stitches and between 
3rd and 4th stitches. Trim ends evenly.
