Hanging Loops 
Cut 5 strands of E, each 8” (20.5 cm) 
long. Fold each strand in half and tie ends 
together with an overhand knot to form a 
loop. With right side and top edge facing, 
thread folded end of loop from front to 
back through ch-2 space of Row 11, open 
strands of hanging loop below knot and 
insert the folded end. Pull up the folded 
end so knotted end tightens around stitch. 
Repeat to join remaining 4 hanging loops in 
top of 4th, 6th, 8th, and last stitches. Adjust 
as needed to place knots on wrong side. 
Weave in ends.
Insert dowel or stick through hanging loops 
and tie on twine for hanging.

materials: Red Heart® Kids™ (Multi: 4 oz/113 g; 232 yds/212 m) Blue/Green Multicolour 6 balls
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Dowel rod ½" x 24" [1.25 x 61 cm].
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at back of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice - 1 dcbp made
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at front of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice - 1 dcfp made
Sc2(3)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2(3) sc(stitches). Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
Scbl = Single crochet through back loop only
measurements: Approx 18" x 27" (45.7 x 68.6 cm), excluding hanging tabs.
gauge: 3 groups of 3 sts = 2½" [6.5 cm], 6 rows = 2¼" [5.5 cm] in pat
instructions:
Note: Ch 3 at beg of rows counts as dc.
Ch 65.
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook and in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 63 dc.
2nd row: Ch 3. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 dc. *1 dcbp around each of next 3 dc. 1 dcfp around each of next 3 dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd to 64th rows: As 2nd row.
65th to 67th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn. 63 sc.
68th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 31 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 62 sc. Do not fasten off.
Tab 1
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 7 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 7 sc.
2nd to 12th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
13th row: (buttonhole row)Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Ch 1. Skip next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn. 4 sc and ch-1 sp.
14th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc3tog. 1 sc in last sc. Fasten off.
Tabs 2 to 5
1st row: (RS). Skip next 4 sc of last row 68. Join yarn with sl st in next sc. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 7 sc.
2nd to 14th rows: As 2nd to 14th rows of First Tab.
Tab 6
1st row: (RS). Skip next 4 sc of last row 68. Join yarn with sl st in next sc. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of last 6 sc. Turn. 7 sc.
2nd to 14th rows: As 2nd to 14th rows of First Tab. Do not fasten off at end of last row.
Edging
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 1. Work sc in each st and in end of each row around, working 3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st in first sc. Fasten off.
POCKETS (Make 2)
Top Ribbing: Ch 9.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 8 sc.
2nd to 63rd rows: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. Turn. Do not fasten off at end of last row.
Body of Pocket: 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in end of each ribbing row to end of chain. Turn. 63 sc.
2nd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd to 22nd rows: Ch 3. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 dc. *1 dcbp around each of next 3 dc. 1 dcfp around each of next 3 dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
23rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Fasten off.
Border: With RS facing, join yarn with sl st at top left corner of Pocket. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each st and in end of each row around to top right corner of Pocket, working 3 sc in each bottom corner. Fasten off.
FINISHING
With RS facing, sew buttons to correspond to buttonholes of tabs in place between rows 67 and 68. Pin one Pocket in place across bottom of Wall Hanging as shown in photo. Sew in place. Pin remaining Pocket in place 4" (10 cm) above bottom of Wall Hanging. Sew in place making sure bottom of Pocket is straight.

materials: RED HEART® Anne Geddes Baby™: 3 balls 504 Robin A, 1 ball each of 100 Lily B and 203 Daffodil C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8] and 3.5mm [US E-4]
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Wall Hanging measures 20” [50 cm wide x 30” [76 cm] tall.
gauge: 12 dc = 4” [10cm]; 6 rows = 4” [10cm] in double crochet
instructions:
HANGING
With 2 strands of A held together and larger hook, ch 64.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across – 63 sc.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), turn, dc in next 6 sts, *ch 1, skip next st, dc in next 7 sts; repeat from * across.
Rows 3-4: Ch 3, turn, dc in next 6 sts, *ch 1, skip ch-1 space, dc in next 7 sts; repeat from * across.
Row 5: Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1), turn, skip next st, dc next st, *ch 1, skip next st, dc in next st; repeat from * across.
using 2 strands of yarn held together. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.

Rows 6-37: Repeat Rows 2-5.
Rows 38-40: Repeat Rows 2-4.
Row 41: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across – 63 sc.

Tabs
Row 42: Ch 1, turn, working in front loops only, sc in next 9 sc, leave remaining sts unworked.
*Rows 43-54: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 9 sc.
Joining Row: Fold Tab in half to wrong side to line up with wrong side of Row 41, working through both sts of Row 54 and unworked back loops of Row 41, sc in each st across to join*, sc in next 13 sts of Row 41, repeat from * to * for 2nd tab, [sc in next 14 sts of Row 41, repeat from * to * for next tab] twice, sc in next 13 sts of Row 41, repeat from * to * for last tab.

FINISHING
First Point
Row 1: With 2 strands of B held together and larger hook, working across opposite side of foundation ch, join yarn in first ch 1, sc in same ch, sc in next 62 ch – 63 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 12 sc, leave remaining sts unworked.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in first sc, sc2tog, sc to last 3 sc, sc2tog, sc in last sc – 10 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Rows 5-8: Repeat Rows 3-4 – 6 sc on last row.
Row 9: Ch 1, turn, sc in first sc, [sc2tog] twice, sc in last sc – 4 sc.
Row 10: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Row 11: [Sc2tog] twice – 2 sc.
Row 12: Sc2tog.
Fasten off.

Second Point
Row 2: With 2 strands of B held together and larger hook, join yarn in next unworked st on Row 1, ch 1, sc in same st, sc in next 11 sc – 12 sc. 
Work as for First Point. 

Third Point
Row 2: With 2 strands of B held together, join yarn in next unworked st on Row 1, ch 1, sc in same st, sc in next 14 sc – 15 sc. 
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in first sc, sc2tog, sc to last 3 sc, sc2tog, sc in last sc – 12 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across. 
Rows 5-12: Repeat Rows 3-4 – 5 sc on last row.
Row 13: Ch 1, turn, sc in first sc, sc3tog, sc in last sc – 3 sc.
Row 14: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Row 15: Sc3tog. 
Fasten off.
Fourth and Fifth Point
Work as for Second Point.

Edging
With 2 strands of B held together and larger hook, join yarn in first row along one side edge, sc evenly spaced around Points, working 3 sc in each point. Fasten off. 

LETTERS 
R
With smaller hook and 1 strand of B, ch 8.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across – 7 sc. 
Row 2: Ch 5, turn, skip 3 sc, sc next sc for center sc, ch 5, turn, sc in 2nd ch from hook and next 3 ch, slip st in center sc, sc in 4 ch of first ch-5 space, slip st in edge of Row 1.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
O
With smaller hook and 1 strand of B, ch 17, slip st in first ch to join. 
Round 1: Sc in each ch around. 
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Y
Make 2
Row 1: With smaller hook and 1 strand of B, [ch 5, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 3 ch] twice, slip st in first ch, ch 5, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 3 ch, slip st in same slip st. 
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
A
Make 2
Row 1: With smaller hook and 1 strand of B, ch 8, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 3 ch, ch 3, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next ch for center bar, sc in next 3 ch of ch-8, turn, ch 4, slip st in tip of center bar, ch 5, turn, sc in 2nd ch from hook and next 3 ch, sc in slip st, sc in last 4 ch, slip st in first st. 
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
L
With smaller hook and 1 strand of B, ch 12.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 2 ch, skip next ch, sc in last 7 ch.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
B
Make 2
With smaller hook and 1 strand of B, ch 8. 
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across – 7 sc.
Row 2: Ch 5, turn, skip 3 sc, sc in next sc, ch 6, skip next 2 sc, slip st in last sc. 
Row 3: Turn, skip slip st, sc in next 6 ch, slip st in sc, sc in last 5 ch, slip st in edge of Row 1.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Arrange Letters to spell “Royal Baby” in center of first 2 rows of Squares of Wall Hanging and sew in place. 

PLAQUE
Carry colors not in use loosely alongside of work.
With smaller hook and 1 strand of B, ch 41. 
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across – 40 sc. 
Row 2: Ch 3, turn, dc in each sc across.
Rows 3-4: Change to A, ch 1, turn, sc in each st across.
Row 5: Change to B, ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Row 6: Ch 3, turn, dc in each sc across.
Rows 7-42: Repeat Rows 3-6. 
Border Edging
Round 1: Ch 1, turn, sc evenly spaced around all edges, working 3 sc in each corner, slip st in first sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, *sc in each sc to first sc of corner, slip st in first sc, ch 4, slip st in next sc, ch 4, slip st in same sc,  ch 4, slip st in next sc; repeat from *, sc in each sc to first st, slip st in first st. 

CROWN
With smaller hook and 1 strand of C, ch 25.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across – 24 sc.
Rows 2-5: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Row 6: Ch 1, turn, sc in first sc, puff in next sc, *sc in next 3 sc, puff in next sc; repeat from * across to last 2 sc, sc in last 2 sts.
Row 7: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Row 8: Ch 3, turn, dc in each st across.
Row 9: Ch 3, turn, *Bpdc, Fpdc; repeat from * to last st, dc in last st.
Rows 10-11: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across.
Shape Points
Right Point
Row 12: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 7 sc, leave remaining sts unworked – 7 sc.
Row 13: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc – 7 sc.
Row 14: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across. 
Row 15: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in next 5 sc –  
6 sc.
Row 16: Ch 1, turn, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog.
Row 17: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in next 4 sc –  
5 sc.
Row 18: Ch 1, turn, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 4 sc – 6 sc.
Row 19: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in next 4 sc –  
5 sc.
Row 20: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog –  
4 sc.
Row 21: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in next 2 sc –  
3 sc.
Row 22: Ch 1, turn, sc in next sc, sc2tog – 2 sc.
Row 23: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog – 1 sc.
Fasten off

Middle Point
Row 12: Join C in next unworked st of Row 11, ch 1, turn, sc in same st, sc in next 9 sc, leave remaining sts unworked – 10 sc.
Row 13: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across. 
Row 14: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in next 6 sc, sc2tog – 8 sc.
Rows 15-16: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across. 
Row 17: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in each sc to last 2 sc, sc2tog – 6 sc.
Rows 18-20: Repeat Rows 15-17 – 4 sc.
Row 21-24: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across. 
Row 25: Ch 1, turn, [sc2tog] twice – 2 sc.
Row 26: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog – 1 sc.
Fasten off

Left Point
Row 12: Join C in next unworked st of Row 11, ch 1, turn, sc in same st, sc in next 6 sc, leave remaining sts unworked – 7 sc.
Row 13: Ch 1, turn, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 4 sc, sc2tog – 7 sc.
Row 14: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across. 
Row 15: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 5 sc, sc2tog –  
6 sc.
Row 16: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc.
Row 17: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 4 sc, sc2tog –  
5 sc.
Row 18: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc – 6 sc.
Row 19: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 4 sc, sc2tog –  
5 sc.
Row 20: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in next 3 sc –  
4 sc.
Row 21: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog – 
3 sc.
Row 22: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in next sc – 2 sc.
Row 23: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog – 1 sc.
Fasten off

Edging
With right side facing, join C in any st, sc evenly spaced around edges of Crown, working 3 sc in each point and corners, slip st to first st. Fasten off.

Large Star
With smaller hook and 1 strand of C, ch 2. 
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook, slip st in first sc.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around, slip st in first sc – 12 sc.
Round 3: [Ch 4, slip st in 2nd ch from hook, sc next ch, hdc last ch, skip next sc, slip st in next sc] 6 times. 
Fasten off. 

Small Star (Make 2)
With smaller hook and 1 strand of C, ch 4, slip st in first ch to form a ring. 
Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as first dc), 11 dc in ring, slip st in top of beginning ch – 12 dc.
Fasten off. 

Sew Crown in center of Plaque. Sew Large Star on Middle Point. Sew one Small Star on each remaining Point. 
Sew Plaque in center of Wall Hanging. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein 385 Royal A, 316 Soft White B, and 319 Cherry Red C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 5mm [US H-8] and 5.5mm [US I-9]
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Bunting measures 54” (137 cm) wide x 5” (12.5 cm) long.
gauge: 1 triangle = 6” (15 cm) across Row 1. Gauge is not critical for this project but keep tension even.
instructions:
BANNER
Solid Triangle (make 5) 
With larger hook and A, ch 17.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—16 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first st, skip next st, sc in each st across to last 2 sts, skip next st, sc in last st, turn—14 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Rows 4–13: Repeat last 2 rows 5 times—4 sc.
Row 14: Ch 1, [sc2tog] 2 times, turn—2 sc.
Row 15: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Row 16: Ch 1, sc2tog—1 sc. Fasten off.
Edging Row: With right side facing and working in ends of rows down first side, join A with sc in first row, sc in same row, skip next row, *2 sc in next row, skip next row*; repeat from * to * 6 times, 3 sc in st of Row 16; working in ends of rows up other side, repeat from * to * 7 times, 2 sc in last row. Fasten off.
Striped Triangle (make 4)
With larger hook and B, ch 17.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—16 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first st, skip next st, sc in each st across to last 2 sts, skip next st, sc in last st; change to C, turn—14 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Rows 4–16: Work same as solid triangle changing color in last st of each even-numbered row in the following sequence: *Work 2 rows with B, 2 rows with C; repeat from * twice.
Cut B. Fasten off C.
Edging Row: With B, work same as solid triangle.
Star (make 5)
With smaller hook and C, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 2 (counts as first hdc), 9 hdc in ring; join with slip st in top of beginning ch, turn—10 hdc.
Round 2: *Ch 3, slip st in 2nd ch from hook, dc in next ch, skip next st, slip st in next st; repeat from * 4 times working last slip st in base of beginning ch. Fasten off.
FINISHING
With right sides facing and beginning with solid triangle, alternately arrange triangles in a single row with Row 1 at top and Row 16 at bottom. With A, ch 10.
Joining Row: *Working in opposite side of foundation ch, sc in each ch across; repeat from * for each triangle, ch 10. Fasten off. 
Weave in ends.
Arrange bunting with right side of solid triangles facing. With wrong side of star facing, apply a dot of hot glue to each point and place the star, right side facing, on center of a solid triangle. Repeat until all stars are glued.

materials: 1 skein each of 316 Soft White A
abbreviations: A, B, C, and D = Color A, B, C, and D
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Each piece of candy corn measures about 5½” (14cm) tall and 5½” (14cm) wide (at widest).
gauge: 13 sts = 4” (10 cm); 11 rows = 4” (10 cm) in half double crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com and www.crochettoday.com
©2012 Coats & Clark
Candy Corn 
Banner
Draped across the mantle or hung in front 
of a window, our Candy Corn Banner helps 
celebrate the spookiest night of the year! 
Simple embroidered accents create the faces 
on these easy to crochet motifs.
Rows 13–15: With C, repeat Row 10 three 
times.
Fasten off.
EYES 
(Make 10 – 2 for each piece of candy corn)
With A, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook—5 sc.
Do not join. Work in continuous rounds 
(spirals). Place a marker for beginning of 
round. Move marker up as each round is 
completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—10 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 5 
times—15 sc.
Slip st in next stitch. Fasten off, leaving a long 
tail for sewing eye to body.
Each piece of candy corn measures about 5½” 
(14cm) tall and 5½” (14cm) wide (at widest).
Notes
1.Each piece of candy corn is made in four
parts: 2 body pieces (for front and back)
and 2 eyes.
2. To change color, work last stitch of old
color to last yarn over. Yarn over with new
color and draw through all loops on hook
to complete stitch. Proceed with new color.
Fasten off old color.
BODY 
(Make 10 – 2 for each piece of candy corn)
With A, ch 3.
Row 1: Work 4 hdc in 3rd ch from hook 
(beginning ch counts as first hdc), turn—5 hdc 
(including beginning ch in the count). 
Row 2: Ch 2 (counts as first hdc here and 
throughout), hdc in first hdc (increase made), 
hdc in next 3 hdc, hdc in top of beginning ch, 
turn—6 hdc.
Row 3: Ch 2, hdc in first hdc, hdc in next 4 
hdc, hdc in top of turning ch, turn—7 hdc.
Row 4: Ch 2, hdc in first hdc, hdc in next 5 
hdc, hdc in top of turning ch and change to B, 
turn—8 hdc.
Row 5: With B, ch 2, 2 hdc in first hdc, hdc in 
next 6 hdc, hdc in top of turning ch, turn—10 
hdc. 
Row 6: Ch 2, 2 hdc in first hdc, hdc in next 8 
hdc, hdc in top of turning ch, turn—12 hdc.
Row 7: Ch 2, 2 hdc in first hdc, hdc in next 10 
hdc, hdc in top of turning ch, turn—14 hdc.
Row 8: Ch 2, 2 hdc in first hdc, hdc in next 12 
hdc, hdc in top of turning ch, turn—16 hdc.
Row 9: Ch 2, 2 hdc in first hdc, hdc in next 14 
hdc, hdc in top of turning ch, turn—18 hdc.
Rows 10–12: Ch 2, skip first hdc, hdc in each 
hdc across, hdc in top of turning ch, turn—18 
hdc. Change to C in last st of Row 12.

FINISHING
Face: Use photograph as a guide. With yarn 
needle and long tail, sew two eyes to five 
candy corn body pieces for fronts. Sew 
one 5mm black button to each eye. With D, 
embroider straight stitch mouth and tongue on 
each front. 
Assembly: Hold one front (with face) and one 
back (without face) with wrong sides together. 
From right side and working through both 
thicknesses, join D with sc in edge, sc evenly 
spaced around to join front and back; join with 
slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Weave in ends. With yarn needle, thread a 
long strand of D through the tops of the candy 
corn pieces to make banner. Tie knots in 
strand of D to hold pieces in place and space 
as desired.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein 312 Black A and 316 Soft White B
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Spider measures 4” high x 4” (10 x 10 cm) diameter across bottom.
gauge: 5 sts = 4” (10 cm); 5 rows = 4” (10 cm) in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SPIDER (make 3)
Body
With A, ch 2.
Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc. Place marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around —12 sc.
Round 3: *Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—18 sc.
Round 4: *Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—24 sc.
Round 5: *Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—30 sc.
Round 6: Sc in each sc around.
Round 7: *Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—36 sc.
Rounds 8–10: Sc in each sc around.
Round 11: *Sc in next 4 sc, sc2tog; repeat from * around—30 sc.
Round 12: *Sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog; repeat from * around—24 sc.

Head
Rounds 1–4: Work same as Rounds 1–4 of body—24 sc.
Rounds 5–7: Sc in each sc around.
Round 8: *Sc2tog; repeat from * around—12 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Stuff lightly. Do not close opening. Hold head on top of body and sew in place.

Eye (make 2)
With B, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

FINISHING
With A, embroider French knot in center of each eye. Sew eyes on head. With embroidery floss, embroider a V-shaped couched stitch for mouth.

Legs
Working between stitches, create 8 small holes on body by inserting and twisting the point of closed scissors into the stuffing. Squeeze a small amount of glue into each hole and insert 1”–1½” (2.5–4 cm) of chenille stem. Allow glue to dry thoroughly before handling. Using photograph as a guide, bend each leg down towards the body at about the midpoint of the stem, then bend up about 1” (2.5 cm) from the end to create the foot.

Round 13: *Sc2tog; repeat from * around—12 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Stuff lightly. Weave tail through last round and pull stitches closed.

Special Stitch
sc2tog = [Insert hook in next stitch, yarn over and pull up a loop] twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.

Notes
1. Spiders are made in continuous rounds with right side facing. Do not join at end of round until instructed. Place marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed.
2. Gauge is not critical for this project, but work tightly to ensure that stuffing does not show through stitches.

materials: Bernat® Super Value™ (7 oz/197 g; 440 yds/402 m)
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
¼" [25 mm] wooden dowel, approx 18" [45.5 cm] long.
abbreviations: Sc2(3)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2(3) stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 13" [33 cm] wide x 16" [40.5 cm] long, excluding tassel.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
With A, ch 45.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 44 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row 8 times more.
Next (joining) row: Fold work so foundation ch is aligned with next row. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work 1 sc in each sc and rem loop of foundation ch to end of row to form top casing. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row 37 times more, for a total of 38 rows from joining row.
Dec rows: 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. Sc3tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 3 sc. Sc3tog. Turn. 40 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. Sc3tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 3 sts. Sc3tog. Turn. 36 sts.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows to 6 sts.
Next row: (RS). (Sc3tog) twice. 2 sts.
Next row: Sc2tog. Fasten off.
FINISHING
With B, following chart, cross stitch words onto front of Banner, beg 7 rows down from joined row.
Hanging Cord: With B, ch 50. Fasten off.
Insert dowel through top casing. Tie Hanging Cord to dowel at either side of Banner as shown in picture.
Tassel
Cut a piece of cardboard 7" [18 cm] wide. Wind B around cardboard 50 times. Break yarn leaving a long end and thread end through needle. Slip needle through all loops and tie tightly. Remove cardboard and wind yarn tightly around loops 1" [2.5 cm] below fold. Fasten securely. Cut through rem loops and trim ends evenly. Sew Tassel to point of Banner.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (Solids: 2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m; Ombres: 2 oz/56.7 g; 95 yds/86 m)
Size U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Wooden dowel approx 24" [61 cm] long x ½" [1.5 cm] diameter.
measurements: Approx 20" x 24" [51 x 61 cm], excluding fringe.
gauge: 14 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions: Note: When working from chart and joining new color, work to last 2 loops on hook of last st. Draw new color through 2 loops, then proceed in new color. Carry color not in use across top of previous row and work sts around it to prevent stranding. With A, ch 71.  1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 70 sc. 2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn. Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 2" [5 cm]. Beg working Chart in sc, reading RS rows from right to left and WS rows from left to right, until 73rd row of Chart is complete. Place marker at end of last row. Chart is shown on page 2. Next row: With D, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Rep last row until work from marker measures 3" [7.5 cm], ending on a RS row. Next row – Seam row: (RS). Ch 1. Working in front loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Next row: With D, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Rep last row until work from marker measures 4" [10 cm]. Fasten oﬀ, leaving a long yarn tail. FINISHING: With long yarn tail, sew final row to rem back loops of Seam row to create casing. Insert dowel in casing to hang. With F, embroider eye and mouth with chain stitch (see chart for placement). Fringe: Cut strands of A 23" [58.5 cm] long. Taking 2 strands tog, fold in half and knot into fringe along bottom edge of Wall Hanging. Trim fringe evenly. Fringe: Cut yarn 10 to 14 ins [25.5 to 35.5 cm] long. Taking 2 or 3 strands together for each fringe knot into fringe across cast on and cast off edges. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: Red Heart® All in One™ Flower Power™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 417 yds/381 m)
Contrast A Peony Pop (2021) 1 ball or 6 Squares and 112 yds/102 m for fringe
Contrast B Cherry Blossom (2000) 1 ball or 5 Squares and 137 yds/125 m for fringe and top edging
Contrast C Poppy Star (2018) 1 ball or 5 Squares and 91 yds/83 m for fringe and tassel
Contrast D Hyacinth Bucket (2017) 1 ball or 5 Squares and 112 yds/102 m for fringe
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
60" [152.5 cm] long piece of wooden dowel ½" [1.5 cm] diameter
measurements: Approx 30" [76 cm] deep at center x 51" [129.5 cm] wide, excluding fringe.
gauge: Motif = Approx 6" [15 cm] square. 12 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
FLOWER POWER MOTIF
Notes:
• Each Color aligns with specific round(s) in the Motif using 3 Colors in total.
• Motif begins with Color 1 (shortest color rep) from center of pull-skein, leaving a 4" [10 cm] tail to weave in.
• 2nd and 3rd rnds will be worked in Color 2.
• 4th, 5th and 6th rnds will be worked in Color 3.
• If too much color is left at end of rnd, pull back some sts and slightly loosen gauge to re-work sts and finish at color change. If too little color is left, pull back some sts and slightly tighten gauge to re-work sts and finish at color change.

• At end of final rnd, Motif should measure 6" [15 cm] square, with long tail (at least 24" [61 cm]) rem for seaming.
• Adjust gauge as needed working 4th, 5th and 6th rounds of Flower Motif to maintain 6" [15 cm] square finished size.
• Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.
• Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st.
• Join all rnds with sl st to first st unless otherwise stated.

Make 6 Squares with A, and 5 Squares each with B, C, and D – 21 Squares total.

With Color 1, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3. Work 9 dc in ring. Join. 10 dc. Color 1 complete.
2nd rnd: Color 2 begins. Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. 2 dc in each dc around. Join. 20 dc.
3rd rnd: Sl st in next dc. (Ch 3. 1 tr) in same st as last sl st. 3 tr in next dc. (1 tr. 1 dc) in next dc. Sl st in next dc. *(1 dc. 1 tr) in next dc. 3 tr in next dc. (1 tr. 1 dc) in next dc. Sl st in next dc. Rep from * around, ending by joining with sl st to top of ch-3 of previous (2nd) rnd. Color 2 complete.
4th rnd: Color 3 begins. Sl st in first dc. Ch 3. *1 dc in next tr. 1 hdc in next tr. 1 sc in next tr. 1 hdc in next tr. 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. 1 tr in dc of 2nd rnd below sl st.** 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * 3 times more, then from * to ** once. Join.
5th rnd: Ch 6 (counts as tr and ch-2). 1 tr in same sp as sl st. *2 dc in next st. Ch 1. 1 dc in next st. 1 hdc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Ch 1. Skip next st. 1 sc in next st. 1 hdc in next st. 1 dc in next st. Ch 1. 2 dc in next st.** (1 tr. Ch 2. 1 tr) all in next st. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. Join to 4th ch of ch-6.
6th rnd: Sl st in next ch-2 sp. Ch 2 (does not count as st). 1 hdc in same ch-2 sp. Ch 3. 3 hdc in same ch-2 sp. Ch 1. *(3 hdc. Ch 1) in each ch-1 sp to next corner ch-2 sp.** (3 hdc. Ch 3. 3 hdc) all in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. 2 hdc in first ch-2 sp. Join. Fasten off at end of Color 3, leaving long tail for seaming.
Motif should measure 6" [15 cm] square (see Notes).

ASSEMBLY
Seaming with Flat Sl St Join: (RS). With Color 3 from A, sl st Motifs tog into 5 Strips as shown in Assembly Diagram I (see page 4), working through back loops only and keeping working yarn to WS of work to create a flat sl st chain detail on RS of work (see diagram).
Sl st Strips and rem Square tog as shown in Assembly Diagram II (see page 4).
Note: Keep working yarn to WS of work so only flat sl st chain is visible on RS.

Top Edging (see diagram)
With RS facing, join B with sl st to top corner ch-3 sp of right-most square of Wall Hanging (marked A on Assembly Diagram III).
1st row: Ch 1. 3 sc in same ch-3 sp. (Ch 23. 3 sc in ch-3 sp of next Square) 5 times. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 7 (hanging loop). Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc. (1 sc in each of next 23 ch. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 7. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc) 5 times. Fasten off. Thread wooden dowel through Top Edging.

Tassel
Cut a piece of cardboard 12" [30.5 cm] wide. Wind C around cardboard 100 times. Break yarn, leaving a long end. Thread end through a needle. Slip needle through all loops and tie tightly. Remove cardboard and wind yarn tightly around loops ¾" [2 cm] below fold.
Attach one Tassel to center ch-3 sp at bottom of Wall Hanging.

Fringe
Cut lengths of yarn 25" [63.5 cm]. Taking 6 strands tog, knot into fringe into each ch-1 and ch-3 sp along bottom edges of Wall Hanging, matching shade of fringe to shade of Square. Trim fringe evenly.

pattern_name: IN IT FOR THE DRAMA CROCHET WALL HANGING
materials: Bernat® Velvet™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 315 yds/288 m) Main Color (MC) Blackbird (63002) 1 ball or 158 yds/145 m
Contrast A  Bronze (32082) 1 ball or 18 yds/17 m
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 20" [51 cm] wide x 11" [28 cm] tall, excluding fringe.
gauge: 12 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note:  Ch 2 at beg of rows does not count as st.
With MC, ch 10. See diagram on page 3.
1st row:  (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to last chain. 2 sc in last ch. Do not turn. Working in rem loops of foundation ch, 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 19 sc.
2nd and alt rows:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
3rd row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 8 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of last 8 sc. Turn. 22 sc.
5th row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 8 sc. 2 sc in each of next 6 sc. 1 sc in each of last 8 sc. Turn. 28 sc.
7th row:  Ch 2. 1 dc in each of first 5 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 3 sts. (2 sc in next st. 1 sc in next st) 3 times. (1 sc in next st. 2 sc in next st) 3 times. 1 hdc in each of next 3 sts. 1 dc in each of last 5 sts. 34 sts.
9th row:  Ch 2. 1 dc in each of first 5 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 3 sts. (2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts) 3 times. (1 sc in each of next 2 sts. 2 sc in next st) 3 times. 1 hdc in each of next 3 sts. 1 dc in each of last 5 sts. Turn. 40 sts.
11th row: Ch 2. 1 dc in each of first 5 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 3 sts. (2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts) 3 times. (1 sc in each of next 3 sts. 2 sc in next st) 3 times. 1 hdc in each of next 3 sts. 1 dc in each of last 5 sts. Turn. 46 sts.
13th row: Ch 2. 1 dc in each of first 5 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 3 sts. (2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts) 3 times. (1 sc in each of next 4 sts. 2 sc in next st) 3 times. 1 hdc in each of next 3 sts. 1 dc in each of last 5 sts. Turn. 52 sts.
15th row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 8 sts. (2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts) 3 times. (1 sc in each of next 5 sts. 2 sc in next st) 3 times. 1 sc in each of last 8 sts. Turn. 58 sts.
17th row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 8 sts. (2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 6 sts) 3 times. (1 sc in each of next 6 sts. 2 sc in next st) 3 times. 1 sc in each of last 8 sts. Turn. 64 sts.
19th row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 8 sts. (2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 7 sts) 3 times. (1 sc in each of next 7 sts. 2 sc in next st) 3 times. 1 sc in each of last 8 sts. Turn. 70 sts.
21st row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 12 sts. 2 sc in next st. (1 sc in each of next 8 sts. 2 sc in next st) 5 times. 1 sc in each of last 12 sts. Turn. 76 sts.
23rd row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 8 sts (2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 9 sts) 3 times. (1 sc in each of next 9 sts. 2 sc in next st) 3 times. 1 sc in each of last 8 sts. Turn. 82 sts.
25th row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 13 sts. 2 sc in next st. (1 sc in each of next 10 sts. 2 sc in next st) 5 times. 1 sc in each of last 13 sts. Turn. 88 sts.
27th row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 8 sts. (2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 11 sts) 3 times. (1 sc in each of next 11 sts. 2 sc in next st) 3 times. 1 sc in each of last 8 sts. Turn. 94 sts.
29th row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 14 sts. 2 sc in next st. (1 sc in each of next 12 sts. 2 sc in next st) 5 times. 1 sc in each of last 14 sts. Do not turn. 100 sts.
Ch 1. Sl st evenly across straight edge of Wall Hanging.
Fasten off.
FRINGE
Back Layer: Cut 8 strands of MC 80" [203] cm long. Taking 1 strand, fold in half and working in back loops only, knot into fringe along middle 8 sts of Wall Hanging.
Middle Layer:  Cut 22 strands of A 40" [101.5 cm] long. Taking 1 strand, fold in half and working in back loops only, over Bottom Layer Fringe, knot into fringe along middle 20 sts of Wall Hanging.
Top Layer: Cut 84 strands of MC 24" [61] cm long. Taking 1 strand, fold in half and working in front loops only, knot into fringe beg 9 sts in from left corner and ending 9 sts before right corner of Wall Hanging. 
All Layers: Trim fringe evenly, as shown in picture. 
FINISHING
With MC, using whip st, attach Wall Hanging to dowel.
WHIP STITCH
Cut strand of A 30" [76 cm] long. Tie each end to dowel for hanging cord.

materials: RED HEART® Anne Geddes Baby™: 1 ball each of 100 Lily A
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 3.25 mm [US D-3] and 3.5 mm [US E-4]
Sewing needle and matching sewing thread
Black embroidery floss and embroidery needle
abbreviations: A, B, C, D, E = color A, B, C, D, E
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: 8 pennants = 49” (122 cm) wide x 6” (15 cm) deep. Pennant = 5¼” (13.5 cm) wide x 6” (15 cm) tall
gauge: With larger hook, 20 sts and 18 rows sc = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com and www.crochettoday.com
©2013 Coats & Clark
Baby’s Place 
Banner
Whether celebrating a newborn’s arrival or momentous first birthday, this bunting lends an air of happiness to the occasion. For everyday decorating crochet your pennants in your nursery’s colors and hang them at the window or on a wall.
of foundation ch, sc in each ch across, 3 sc in corner st, rotate to work across side edge, work 25 sc evenly spaced across to bottom point, 3 sc in point, rotate to work across other side, work 25 sc evenly spaced across other side edge, 2 sc in last corner; join with a slip st in first sc.
Work now progresses in rows.
Row 2: Ch 1, working across top edge of the pennant, sc in same st and in each st across to next corner, turn – 25 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in each of next 23 sts, 2 sc in last st, turn – 27 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in each st across, ch 8, sl st in last sc made (button loop). Fasten off. Weave in ends.
Striped Pennant 
Make 1 pennant in stripes consisting of color A & each of the 4 colors for girl- B, C, D, E (CC Contrasting Color) (1 pennant in stripes of color A & colors C & F & 2 pennants in B for boy version ).
Row 1-2: Following directions for the solid pennant, begin rows with colored yarn for 2 rows, add color A at end of 2nd stripe row, do not finish off colored yarn.
Row 3-4: Work 2 sc rows of color A, changing to colored yarn at end of 2nd stripe row, do not finish off color A.
Row 5-24: follow instructions for solid bunting in 2 stripe per color pattern as directed, do NOT change color at end of row 24.
Row 25: Ch 1 & turn, skip 1st st , sc 2 tog, finish off color A.
Edging 
Round 1: With right side facing, join CC with a slip st in top right-hand corner st, ch 1, working across opposite side of foundation ch, sc in each ch across, rotate to work across side edge, work 25 sc evenly spaced across to bottom point, 3 sc in point, rotate, work 25 sc evenly spaced along other side edge; join with a slip st in first sc. Fasten off CC.
Row 2: With right side facing, join A with a slip st in top right-hand corner st, ch 1, working across top edge of the pennant, sc in same st and in each st across to next corner, turn – 25 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in each of next 23 sts, 2 sc in last st, turn – 27 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in each st across ch 8, sl st in last sc made (button loop). Fasten off A. Weave in ends.
Bunny Head (make 1 each in B and E)
With smaller hook, ch 4. 
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next ch, 2 sc in next, sc in last ch, turn – 4 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first sc, 2 sc in each of next 2 sc, sc in last st, turn – 6 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each of first 2 sts, 2 sc in each of next 2 sc, sc in each of last 2 sts, turn – 8 sts.
Row 4: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each of next 6 sts, 2 sc in last st, turn – 10 sc.
Row 5-7: Sc in each st across, (10 sts).
Row 8: Ch 1, skip first st, sc in each of next 7 sts, sc2tog over last 2 sts, turn – 8 sc.
Row 9: Ch 1, sc in each of first 2 sts, [sc2tog over next 2 sts] twice, sc in last 2 sts, turn – 6 sts.
Row 10: Ch 1, skip first st, sc in each of next 3 sts, sc2tog over last 2 sts, turn – 4 sc.
Edging
Row 1: working across side edge, bottom edge and other side edge, work 21 sc evenly around around 3 sides, join with a slip st in first sc of Row 10. Fasten off.
Bunny Ears (make 2 each in B and E)
With smaller hook, ch 5.
Round 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next 3 ch, 5 hdc in next ch, working across opposite side of foundation ch, sc in each of next 3 ch, join with a slip st in next ch. Fasten off, leaving a sewing length. 
Bear Head (make 1 each in C and D)
Work same as Bunny Head.
Bear Ears (make 2 each in C and D)
With smaller hook, make an adjustable ring. 
Round 1: Ch 1, work 8 sc in ring, do not join, tighten ring. Fasten off, leaving a sewing length.
Muzzle (make 4)
With smaller hook and A, ch 4.
Round 1 Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next ch, 3 sc in last ch, working across opposite side of foundation ch, sc in next ch, 2 sc in last ch, join with a slip st in first sc. Fasten off A.
FINISHING
To make bunny nose: Referring to the photograph and using coordinating yarn remnant, embroider a triangle for nose onto muzzle as pictured as follows: Bring threaded needle up through the top center of the muzzle. Angle needle to the right and make a straight st into top of the muzzle. Bring needle back through the starting point and angle the needle to the left for the 2nd side of the triangle shape. Fill in nose by making a stitch across the top, connecting the 2 side sts. Repeat for 2nd bunny muzzle.
To make bear nose: Working the nose in the middle of the muzzle as pictured, repeat directions for bunny nose.
Using yarn ends, sew matching ears to each head as pictured. Weave in ends.
Attach muzzles to faces using sewing needle and matching sewing thread. Carefully place muzzles in lower portion of face. Shape muzzle for bunny by making a vertical stitch with white sewing thread or yarn at the bottom center of the muzzle. Pull tightly to form indentation. With black embroidery floss, satin st eyes on each head as pictured. Place each motif in the same basic location, lower edge on each solid white pennant and attach using sewing needle and thread. Leave top of bunny ears unattached for added 3-D interest, as desired.
Sew one button in each top right-hand corner of each pennant using yarn remnant.
Button pennants together to form banner in desired length & color combination. Display securely, away from baby.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 2 skeins 400 Grey Heather A, 1 skein each 316 Soft White B, 319 Cherry Red C, and 672 Spring Green D
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 4 mm [US G-6] and 6 mm [US J-10]
White wooden wall plaque measuring 9” x 11” (23 x 28 cm)
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Reindeer measures 11½” (29 cm) from tip of nose to end of neck.
gauge: 5 sc = 2” (5 cm); 5 rows = 2” (5 cm), with larger hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Head
With larger hook and 2 strands of A held together, ch 2.
Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc. Place marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—18 sc.
Rounds 4–10: Sc in each sc around.
Round 11: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—24 sc.
Round 12: Sc in each sc around.
Round 13: Sc in next 6 sc, 2 sc in next 6 sc, sc in next 12 sc—30 sc.
Round 14: Sc in each sc around.
Round 15: Sc in next 6 sc, [sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times, sc in next 12 sc—36 sc.
Rounds 16–22: Sc in each sc around.
Round 23: [Sc in next 4 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—30 sc.
Round 24: [Sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—24 sc.
Round 25: Sc in each sc around.
Round 26: [Sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—18 sc. Insert stuffing.
Round 27: [Sc in next sc, sc2tog] 6 times—12 sc.
Round 28: [Sc2tog] 6 times—6 sc. Add stuffing as needed. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Weave tail through last sts and pull gently but tightly to close.

Large Antler (make 2)
With larger hook and 2 strands of B held together, ch 2.
Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc. Place marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed.
Rounds 2–22: Sc in each sc around. Stuff firmly, bending slightly as you go to shape.
Round 23: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 3 times—9 sc. Fasten off.

Medium Antler (make 2)
With larger hook and 2 strands of B held together, ch 2.
Rounds 1–16: Work same as Rounds 1–16 of large antler.
Round 17: Work 2 sc in next 2 sc, sc in remaining 4 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Stuff firmly.

Small Antler (make 2)
With larger hook and 2 strands of B held together, ch 2.
Rounds 1–11: Work same as Rounds 1–11 of larger antler.

Ear (make 2)
With larger hook and 2 strands of A held together, ch 2.
Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc. Place marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] twice—8 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] twice—10 sc.
Round 4: [Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] twice—12 sc.
Round 5: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—18 sc.
Rounds 6–12: Sc in each sc around.
Round 13: [Sc in next sc, sc2tog] 6 times—12 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Do not stuff.

Nose
With larger hook and 2 strands of C held together, ch 2.
Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc. Place marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Round 3: Sc in each sc around. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Stuff lightly and sew nose in place.

Neck
With larger hook and 2 strands of A held together, ch 30; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Sc in each ch around—30 sc. Place marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Sc in each sc around.
Round 3: Sc in next 5 sc, [sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 10 times, sc in next 5 sc—40 sc.
Round 4: Sc in each sc around.
Round 5: Sc in next 10 sc, hdc in next 20 sc, sc in next 10 sc.
Round 6: Sc in each sc around.
Rounds 7–10: Repeat Rounds 5 and 6 twice.
Round 11: Working in back loops only, [sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog] 10 times—30 sc.
Round 12: [Sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—24 sc. Fasten off.

Collar
With larger hook and 2 strands of D held together, ch 51.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—50 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across. Fasten off.

Heart (make 6)
With smaller hook and C, ch 2.
Row 1 (right side): Work 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook, turn—3 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last sc, turn—4 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in next sc, 2 sc in next 2 sc, sc in last sc—6 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in next sc, 4 dc in next sc, slip st in next 2 sc, 4 dc in next sc, sc in last sc; working across ends of rows down first side, sc in next 3 rows; working in opposite side of foundation ch, 3 sc in ch; working across ends of rows up other side, sc in next 3 rows; join with slip st in first sc—11 sc and 8 dc. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Weave in ends. Use photograph as a guide to placement of all pieces.
Head and Neck
Using photo as guide, sew button eyes on head.
Sew medium antler to large antler above Round 20. Sew small antler to large antler above Round 14 so it appears in line between large and medium antler. Sew each complete antler firmly to sides of head so it stands out without drooping.
Fold ear in half at Round 13 and sew through all thicknesses. Sew ears under antlers.
Stuff nose lightly and sew in place.
Stuff neck. With last round of neck facing, insert head and sew securely to neck. Add stuffing to neck as needed so neck is firm and evenly shaped. Glue first round of neck to plaque and secure with upholstery tacks placed close to edge of round and spaced evenly around.

Collar
Sew jingle bells evenly spaced around collar. Sew collar around neck at edge of plaque ensuring that tacks are covered.

Chain of Hearts
Row 1: With smaller hook and C, [ch 15, slip st in first slip st of heart] 6 times, ch 15. Fasten off. Drape chain of hearts in desired arrangement on antlers and tack in place as needed.
Weave in remaining ends.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 1 ball each 480 Delft A and 001 White B
Tapestry needle, fabric stiffener, fabric glue (optional)
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Banner measures ¾” (2 cm) wide x 48” (122 cm) long. Star of David Motif measures 3¼” (8.5 cm) wide x 5” (12.5 cm) long after blocking.
gauge: With 3.75mm [F-5] hook and holding two strands together, 5 sc = 1” (2.5 cm), 6 rows sc = 1” (2.5 cm). Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
Star of David Motif (Make 6 with A and 5 with B)
Triangle 1
With 2 strands held together and leaving 6” (15 cm) tail, ch 42.
Round 1: Sc in 2nd from hook and in next 3 ch, (sc, ch 2, sc) in next ch, sc in next 14 ch, (sc, ch 2, sc) in next ch, sc in next 10 ch, (sc, ch 2, sc) in next ch, sc in last 10 ch; join with slip st in first sc—44 sc (2 sides of 16 sc each and 1 side of 12 sc) and 3 ch-2 spaces.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in same st as join and next 4 sc, (sc, ch 2, sc) in next ch-2 space, sc in next 16 sc, (sc, ch 2, sc) in next ch-2 space, sc in next 12 sc, (sc, ch 2, sc) in next ch-2 space, sc in last 11 sc; join with slip st in first sc—50 sc (2 sides of 18 sc each and 1 side of 14 sc) and 3 ch-2 spaces. Fasten off.
Triangle 2
Round 1: Same as triangle 1 Round 1.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in same st as join and next 4 sc, (sc, ch 4, sc) in next ch-2 space (hanging loop made), sc in next 16 sc, (sc, ch 2, sc) in next ch-2 space, sc in next 12 sc, (sc, ch 2, sc) in next ch-2 space, sc in last 11 sc; join with slip st in first sc—50 sc (2 sides of 18 sc each and 1 side of 14 sc) and 3 ch-spaces. Fasten off.

Special Stitches
Fhdc (foundation half double crochet) This technique creates a foundation chain and a row of half double crochet stitches in one = First st: Ch 2, yarn over, insert hook in 2nd ch from hook, yarn over and pull up a loop, yarn over and draw through one loop on hook (the “chain”); yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook (first Fhdc completed). Remaining sts: *Yarn over, insert hook into the “chain” of the previous stitch and pull up a loop, yarn over and draw through one loop on hook (the “chain”); yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook (the “half double crochet”). Repeat from * until desired length is made.
Fhdc-join = Holding motif with wrong side facing, yarn over, insert hook into the “chain” of the previous Fhdc and into hanging loop of motif, and pull up a loop, yarn over and draw through one loop on hook (the “chain”); yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.

Notes
1. Banner and motifs are made by holding two strands of thread together.
2. Star of David motif is made from 2 triangles that are worked in joined rounds with right sides facing and then glued or sewn together.
3. Motifs are joined to banner in a “join as you go” technique through hanging loop.
4. Banner can be made to desired length by increasing or decreasing the number of Fhdc. Join additional Star of David motifs at 4” (10 cm) intervals. Additional thread may be necessary for longer banners and additional motifs.

FINISHING
Motifs
With beginning tail, join first and last stitches of Round 1 of each triangle at lower edge; weave in ends. Block and stiffen each triangle to 3¼” (8.5 cm) wide across lower edge x 4” (10 cm) long. Using photograph as a guide, with right sides facing, and with hanging loop of triangle 2 at top, place triangle 1 upside down on top of triangle 2 and sew or glue together where outer edges meet.

Banner
Row 1: With two strands of A held together, work as many Fhdc as needed for 48” (122 cm) length, alternating colors when joining each motif with Fhdc-join at intervals of 4” (10 cm); change to B in last st, turn.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each st; change to A, turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, hdc in first st, ch 12, hdc in same st and in each st across, ch 12, hdc in last st. Fasten off and weave in ends. Stiffen banner, if desired.

materials: Bernat® Baby Blanket™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 72 yds/65 m)
Contrast A  Vanilla ( 03008 )  3 balls or 190 yds/170 m
Contrast C  Baby Teal ( 03734 )                  1 ball or 16 yds/14.5 m
Contrast D  Seafoam ( 03736 )                   1 ball or 25 yds/23 m
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 12" x 33" [30.5 x 84 cm].
gauge: 7 sc and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as ddc. See diagrams on page 2.
Small Cloud (make 4 pieces alike).
With A, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3. 11 dc in ring. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 12 dc.
2nd rnd: (Sl st in next dc. 4 dc in next dc) 6 times. Sl st in first dc.
Fasten off.
Medium Cloud (make 4 pieces alike).
With A, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3. 11 dc in ring. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 12 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 2 dc in each dc around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 24 dc.
3rd rnd: (Sl st in next dc. Skip 1 dc. 5 dc in next dc. Skip 1 dc) 6 times. Sl st in first dc. Fasten off.
Large Cloud (make 4 pieces alike).
With A, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3. 11 dc in ring. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 12 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 2 dc in each dc around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 24 dc.
3rd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 2 dc in each dc around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 48 dc.
4th rnd: (Sl st in next dc. Skip 2 dc. 5 dc in next dc. Skip 2 dc) 8 times. Sl st in first dc. Fasten off.
Joining Back and Front of Clouds: Place WS of 2 pieces tog. Join yarn with sl st to same sp as last sl st. Working through both thicknesses, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp around, stuffing lightly as you work. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Hanging Loops: With A, make 6 chains, alternating lengths from 3" [7.5 cm] to 6" [15 cm]. Attach to top of Clouds as shown in photo.
Raindrops (make 6 each with B and C).
Ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. (8 sc. Ch 1. 2 dc. Ch 1. 2 sc) all in ring. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off, leaving a 12" [30.5 cm] tail. Using tail, attach Raindrops to Clouds as pictured (3 on Large Clouds, 2 on Medium Clouds, and one on Small Clouds), alternating lengths from 3" [7.5 cm] to 8" [20.5 cm].
FINISHING
Using hanging loops, mount Clouds around embroidery hoop evenly. Make 3 crochet chains 24" [61 cm] long, and attach them around hoop evenly spaced. Join chains in center of hoop with split ring, as pictured.

abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
measurements: Banner measures 30" wide x 25" long (76 x 63.5 cm)
gauge: 13 sc = 4" (10 cm); 13 rows = 4" (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Header
With A, ch 9.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—8 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn. 
Repeat Row 2 until piece measures 30" (76 cm) long.
Fasten off. Weave in ends.
Pompom Strands
Cut 17 strands of B, each measuring 28" (71 cm) long, leaving 4" (10 cm) of cord before or after the pompom at each end.
Thread one end of the cord on yarn needle. Insert the needle through a bead and push bead up close to the pompom.
Tie an overhand knot in the yarn close to the bead. Put a dab of glue on the knot and push the bead down over the knot, adhering the knot and bead together. 
When the glue is dry, trim remaining cord close to the knot.
Referring to photograph as a guide, tie the other end of each bead strand to one edge of header. Tie the strands evenly across, about 2" (5 cm) apart.

materials: YARN: Medium 4: Red Heart® All in One™ Granny Square™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 417 yds/381 m) - Citrus Twist (2002) 1 ball (3 Granny Squares) OR Pink Punch (2001) 1 ball (3 Granny Squares)
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Piece of cardboard 5" [12.5 cm] wide for tassels.
measurements: To fit around 6" [15 cm] diameter plant pot.
gauge: Motif = Approx 6" [15 cm] square.
instructions:
MOTIF
Make 3.
With Color 1, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 6. (3 dc. Ch 3) 3 times in ring. 2 dc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Sl st in ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join.
3rd rnd: Sl st in ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 3 dc in last ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join.
4th and 5th rnds: Sl st in ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *(Ch 1. 3 dc) in each ch-1 sp to next ch-3 sp. Ch 1.** (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join.
Fasten off.

ASSEMBLY
Note: To work Tassel and Straps, use yarn as ‘self-striping’ yarn, allowing colors to change as they appear.
Tassel
Cut a piece of cardboard 5" [12.5 cm] wide. Wind yarn around cardboard 30 times, Break yarn leaving a long end and thread end through needle. Slip needle through all loops and tie tightly. Remove cardboard and wind yarn tightly around loops 2" [5 cm] below fold. Fasten securely. Cut through rem loops and trim ends evenly.
Hanging Straps and Joining Seam
Ch 48. Continue working across edge of 2 Motifs to join as follows: Seaming with Flat Sl St Join: (RS). Sl st 2 Motifs tog, working through back loops only and keeping working yarn to WS of work to create a flat sl st chain detail on RS of work. 
Ch 10. Fasten off leaving long tail.
Rep above steps twice more with rem Motifs to create tube of Motifs.

Note: Keep working yarn to WS of work so only flat sl st chain is visible on RS.
Insert 6" [15 cm] plant pot into center of tube of Motifs, with ch-10 at bottom of Plant Pot. Tie 3 ch-10 tog in an overhand knot where they meet at center of Plant Pot base. Tie Tassel to ends of ch-10 using long tails. Bring 3 lengths of ch-48 to meet above Plant Pot so all 3 lengths are pulled tight. Tie tops of ch-48 tog to create hanging loop.

Weave in ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m) Contrast A Robins Egg (01215) 3 balls or 212 yds/194 m
Contrast B Ecru (00004) 2 balls or 177 yds/162 m
Contrast C Sunshine (00073) 2 balls or 129 yds/118 m
Contrast D Red (00095) 5 balls or 430 yds/400 m
Contrast E Black (00002) 3 balls or 200 yds/182 m
Size U.S. F/5 (3.75 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Sc2(3)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 (3) stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 24 x 36" [61 x 91.5 cm], excluding fringe.
gauge: 15 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm]. Square Motif = Approx 6" [15 cm] square.
instructions:
Square Motif
Make 3 with D as Color 1 and C as Color 2.
Make 3 with A as Color 1 and C as Color 2.
Make 3 with E as Color 1 and A as Color 2.
Make 1 with D as Color 1 and E as Color 2.
Make 1 with B as Color 1 and D as Color 2.
Make 4 with E as Color 1 and B as Color 2.
Make 3 with A as Color 1 and B as Color 2.
With Color 1, ch 2.
**1st row: (RS). 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn.
2nd to 5th rows: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 11 sc at end of 5th row.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
7th to 11th rows: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 21 sc at end of 11th row.
12th row: As 6th row.
13th to 17th rows: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 31 sc at end of 17th row.
18th row: As 6th row.** Join Color 2. Break Color 1.
19th row: With Color 2, as 6th row.
20th to 24th rows: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 21 sts at end of 24th row.
25th row: As 6th row.
26th to 30th rows: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 11 sts at end of 30th row.
31st row: As 6th row.
32nd to 35th rows: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 3 sts at end of 35th row.
36th row: Ch 1. Sc3tog. Fasten off.
Triangle Motif (make 4)
With D, ch 2.
Work from ** to ** as given for Square Motif. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew Motifs tog as shown in diagram.
Fringe
Cut strands of D 36" [91.5 cm] long. Taking 2 strands tog, fold in half and knot into fringe along bottom angled edge of Wall Hanging. Trim fringe evenly.
Sew top of Wall Hanging to dowel or stick.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m) Contrast A Yellow (00010) 1 ball or 30 yds/27 m
Contrast B Beach Glass (01132) 1 ball or 80 yds/73 m
Contrast C Tea Rose (00042) 1 ball or 60 yds/55 m
Contrast D Stonewash (01118) 1 ball or 80 yds/73 m
Size U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Two safety eyes 3/8" [1 cm] diameter (or buttons)
11" x 22" [28 x 56 cm] cardboard for backing (optional)
measurements: Approx 10½" x 21½" [26.5 x 54.5 cm], excluding fringe.
gauge: 14 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Stripe Pat
Work 10 rows of each color in following sequence: A, B, C, D.
With A, ch 2.
1st row: (RS). 7 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn. 7 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in next sc. Turn. 10 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 13 sc.
4th row: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 16 sc.
5th row: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 19 sc.
6th row: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 22 sc.
7th row: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 25 sc.
8th row: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 28 sc.
9th row: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 31 sc.
10th row: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 9 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 34 sc.
First 10 rows of Stripe Pat are complete.
Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, cont as established inc 3 sts every row until Stripe Pat is complete. Fasten off. 124 sc.
FINISHING
Fringe
Cut strands of A, B, C and D 8" [20.5 cm] long. Taking 2 strands tog, fold in half and knot into fringe along bottom edge of Wall Hanging (see picture for placement). Trim fringe evenly.
Face
Attach Safety Eyes as shown in picture. With Black embroidery thread, embroider mouth as shown in picture.
Optional: Trace Wall Hanging (excluding fringe) onto cardboard and cut out. With spray adhesive, glue cardboard to WS of Wall Hanging.

materials: Bernat® Blanket Extra™ (300 g/10.5 oz; 97 yds/87 m)
Size U.S. Q (15 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Wooden dowel 30" [76 cm] long, ¾" [2 cm] diameter.
measurements: Approx 27" [68.5 cm] wide x 48" [122 cm] long, including fringe
gauge: 4 sc and 4 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: When joining new color, work to last 2 loops on hook of first color. Draw new color through last 2 loops and proceed. With A, ch 28. See chart on page 2.
1st Foundation row: (RS). 1 dc in 6th ch from hook (counts as dc, ch 1 and dc). *Ch 1. Skip next ch. 1 dc in next ch. Rep from * to end of chain. Turn.
2nd Foundation row: Ch 1. Working in front loops only, 1 sc in each st to end of row. Join B. Turn. 25 sc.
Proceed in pat as follows (See chart on page 2):
1st row: (RS). With B, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
2nd row: 1 sl st in each sc to end of row. Join A. Turn.
3rd row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each sl st to end of row. Turn.
4th row: As 2nd row. Join B. Turn.
5th row: With B, as 3rd row.
6th to 21st rows: Rep 2nd to 5th rows 4 times more. Break A.
22nd row: (WS). With B, as 2nd row. Join C.
23rd and 24th rows: With C, as 3rd and 2nd rows. Break C.
25th and 26th rows: With B, as 3rd and 2nd rows. Join A. Break B.
27th row: (RS). With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each sl st to end of row. Turn.
28th row: Ch 1. Working in front loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
29th row: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
30th and 31st rows: Rep last 2 rows once more. Do not fasten off.
Note: Twisted Fringe Rows worked across last row and rem loops of 27th and 29th rows. 3 rows of fringe in A in total.
Twisted Fringe Row: **With A, ch 1. *Draw up a loop 10" [25.5 cm] long. Twist loop 30 times. Sl st in same st, allowing twisted loop to coil around itself. Sl st in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Fasten off. **
With RS facing, join A with sl st to rem loop of first st of 29th row. Rep from ** to **. Rep for 27th row.
Short Sections of 5 Twisted Fringes:
First Section: Following chart, join A with sl st to 3rd st of 4th row. Work 5 fringes as before. Following chart, join B with sl st to 3rd st of 6th row. Work 5 fringes as before.
Second Section: Following chart, join A with sl st to 10th st of 14th row. Work 5 fringes as before. Following chart, join B with sl st to 10th st of 16th row. Work 5 fringes as before.
Third Section: Following chart, join A with sl st to 19th st of 22nd row. Work 5 fringes as before. Following chart, join A with sl st to 19th st of 24th row. Work 5 fringes as before.
FINISHING
Thread dowel through 1st Foundation row (dc row).

materials: Patons® Canadiana™  (3.5 oz/100 g; 205 yds/187 m)
Contrast C Pale Grey Mix (10046) 2 balls
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 35" [89 cm] wide x 50" [127 cm] long, excluding fringe.
gauge: 14 sts and 12 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Texture Pat.
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as hdc.
Texture Pat (worked over multiple of 6 + 11 foundation ch)
1st row: (WS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each of next 2 ch. *1 dc in each of next 3 ch. Ch 3. Skip next 3 ch. Rep from * to last 6 ch. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. 1 hdc in each of last 3 ch. Turn. 
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 3 hdc. *Ch 3. Skip next 3 dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch 1 row below. Rep from * to last 6 sts. Ch 3. Skip next 3 dc. 1 hdc in each of last 3 hdc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 3 hdc. *1 dc in each of next 3 dc 1 row below. Ch 3. Skip next 3 dc. Rep from * to last 6 sts. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc 1 row below. 1 hdc in each of last 3 hdc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 3 hdc. *Ch 3. Skip next 3 dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc 1 row below. Rep from * to last 6 sts. Ch 3. Skip next 3 dc. 1 hdc in each of last 3 hdc. Turn.
Rep 3rd and 4th rows for pat until work measures specified length.
Final row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 3 hdc. *1 dc in each of next 3 dc 1 row below. 1 sc in each of next 3 dc. Rep from * to last 6 sts. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc 1 row below. 1 hdc in each of last 3 hdc. Fasten off.

Section 1
With A, ch 125.
Proceed in Texture Pat until work from beg measures approx 8" [20.5 cm], then work Final row.
Section 2
With B, ch 29.
Proceed in Texture Pat until work from beg measures approx 42" [106.5 cm], then work Final row.
Section 3
With C, ch 23.
Proceed in Texture Pat until work from beg measures approx 42" [106.5 cm], then work Final row.
Section 4
With D, ch 77.
Proceed in Texture Pat until work from beg measures approx 34" [86.5 cm], then work Final row.
Section 5
With E, ch 77.
Proceed in Texture Pat until work from beg measures approx 8" [20.5 cm], then work Final row.

FINISHING
Sew Sections tog as shown in Assembly Diagram.
Fringe: Cut strands of D 12" [30.5 cm] long. Taking 2 strands tog, fold in half and knot into fringe across bottom of Tapestry. Trim fringe evenly.
Dowel Sleeve: Fold over top 2" [5 cm] and sew top edge to WS of work, creating a sleeve for the dowel.
Insert dowel into Dowel Sleeve. Cut 40" [101.5 cm] long strand of D. Tie yarn to both ends of dowel for hanging loop.
Fringe: Cut yarn 10 to 14 ins [25.5 to 35.5 cm] long. Taking 2 or 3 strands together for each fringe knot into fringe across cast on and cast off edges. Trim fringe evenly.
